Stephen G
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel Henri truly made our stay in New York City that much more enjoyable. We were always taken care of with any request or accommodations needed and all of the employees were so happy to help make our stay exceed our expectations. Out of all of the amazing staff, Evelyn and Joaquin were our favorite employees. Thank you, we will be back!

The hotel was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large for NYC with great water pressure in the shower. Housekeeping was available quickly for extra coffee pods The front desk staff was able to give great directions. They got a car confirmed for the trip back to the airport. They carried/rolled luggage to car.Odell from the over night front desk helped with cough medicine at 2am. He offered to walk 3 blocks to purchase cough medicine and delivered to the room!Breakfast was hot and delicious but service was slow. This was the 6th stay and my 7th will be booked in a few months

All around a great hotel! We were all very pleased with everything from the staff to the rooms. The staff helped us with all we needed and answered all our questions. We saw people saying in reviews that the rooms were small but we actually really liked the rooms. We would definitely stay here! Thank you for such a wonderful stay.

Handy location and quiet for a NYC hotel, but this place lacking service, attention to detail and even comfort, all the things ever hotel can do with little cost investment. I stayed for 5 nights, it never got better. The bed was squeaky and way too soft, bedding very basic. The staff are unfriendly, they almost seem bothered by having to work, especially the tall waitress in the restaurant who (from my experience) covers the breakfast shift. Every morning I waited at least 15-20 min for the kitchen to toast a bagel and boil an egg-there were only a max of 4 guests at a time. Really?? When I checked in I found rotted milk and carrots in my mini-fridge that must have been there at least a week. The bathroom fan is so loud I could not hear my phone ring. The fan runs while the lights are on, so constantly. The air con was equally noisy, I had to buy earplugs to sleep. The rooftop bar seemed a good idea, I think it’s ran separately. Always quiet which is good since it’s tiny and the only outside space is a narrow walkway with rickety bar stools. The outside restaurant area (called Rodos) at the front of hotel is quaint, but sadly served by the slow kitchen and unfriendly waitstaff. For the price, I would Highly recommend staying elsewhere.

Location great. Room was very dark even with all the lights on. Bathroom is dark too, you have to have the exhaust fan running to get the above light lit, still dark, but now it’s so loud you can’t think. Also, had unscrew a light bulb in order to plug in my curling iron and/or blow dryer. Continental breakfast was a joke! You have to order it from the kitchen, server wasn’t welcoming. Decided to go to Starbucks after we were so disappointed. They should set up a buffet, would rather do it myself then deal with rude servers and a slow kitchen.

Well placed good mattress but annoying things such as a leak in the shower door, small windows and Manhattan high price of course. New York in general has become a ripoff! The hotel does not deserve 4 stars. Too small, no fitness center, no spa. A bit short!

We spent 5 nights at Hotel Henri and would definitely return. I was a little concerned having read lots of reviews that said that the hotel wasn't very clean, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's not as pristine as you might expect, but it certainly didn't feel shabby or dirty, just "well used", which is a good sign because people want to stay there!We had a superior room and were pleased with the size of the bed and the bathroom. There isn't much storage in the room...we hung a few things up but mostly lived out of the suitcase because there were no drawers or shelves to put clothes. There was a useful stand to put the case on, and a large full length mirror. The safe was great...the lid lifts up so it's easy to fit tablets and laptops in.The room was clean, where it mattered. There was an empty pizza box out on the balcony so I don't think the cleaners are the most thorough, but the bed was fresh, the floors were clean and the bathroom was immaculate. Plenty of towels, which were replaced every day, and the shower was amazing! The water and coffee were also plentiful, and we were encouraged to take water out for the day with us as well as having it in our room, which we thought was very generous. The city maps available in reception were the best ones we found. Don't bother buying a tourist map before you go...these freebie ones are brilliant!The location of the hotel is the best feature by far. We couldn't believe how close we were to everything and how easy it was to take the subway when we wanted to go further afield. For that alone, I'd recommend this hotel a million times. We had excellent drinks in Bo's and the Taqueria opposite the hotel, and the Tappo pizza next door was expensive but very tasty and lovely service. 230 Fifth rooftop bar had wonderful views of the Empire State Building and plenty of space to sit outside in the evening sunshine. Eataly had a beautiful rooftop bar as well, so we didn't use the rooftop bar in the hotel because there were so many great places elsewhere!The service from the staff was lovely. Yaya and Joaquin couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and we would like to thank them personally for such a great experience.Overall a great stay in a top location for a very reasonable price.

Checked into hotel after a 6 hour drive. Roi & Joaquin discovered it was my wife & I’s anniversary, and decided to give us complimentary breakfast, a free drink at the bar, and comp champagne. Great Customer Service. They were very helpful with instructions and direction. Awesome experience!

Amazing service! Joaquin, who was working at the front desk, was super friendly and helpful. He even got the kitchen to send crushed ice up to my room when I just asked him where I could get ice. When I left he asked if I needed them to call me a car to the airport since they get a flat rate. Everyone was very attentive and the rooms are pretty stylish and comfortable.

Hotel Henri has a great location and was a good choice for my stay. It’s easy to get anywhere you want to go because it’s close to the 23rd St station at 6th Ave and the 23rd St station at Broadway. At the end of the street is Madison Square Park which is a nice hangout with a view of the Flatiron Building. The neighborhood has tons of excellent restaurant choices within a 5 minute walk. The room itself was small and basic, but modern and very reasonably priced compared to other places in the neighborhood. My room 704 was clean except for the dust on the window blinds. I was traveling solo which was a good thing because my husband and I would have difficulty sharing this Deluxe King room. The closet cabinet was sort of a joke, because it’s not deep enough for hangers. Because of the sliding doors on the closet you can only hang clothes on one side. Thankfully this problem was solved by a huge amount of hooks on the wall. The letters on the wall that say SHOW TIME can all be used as hooks. And there are multiple hooks in the bathroom. One of my biggest complaints about almost all hotel rooms is why can’t they have more hooks? So I was pretty delighted by the hook situation here. One more critique is the lighting in the bath is not bright enough to do makeup. But there is a floor lamp near the desk with very bright bulbs so I sat facing this light with my travel mirror to do my makeup. The vanity in the bath is small but I liked how there is a ledge above the vanity where you can line up all your toiletries. My mattress was kind of creaky and squeaky, could probably be replaced. Overall a good stay.

Was a typical small NY hotel room. The room was clean and efficient. The housekeeper did not replenish my shampoo, even though they did clean the bathroom. The clothes closet was weird in the fact that you had to hang your shirts at a 45 degree angle because the closet wasn't wide enough. They did have the space to widen the closet, but chose not too.

The room is a great place to lay your head at night clean, quite, everything you'd want in a room. The prices are very reasonable especially for NYC Flatiron district. The staff was very pleasant and welcoming to a person.

From the moment we walked in the door, the experience was phenomenal. We were warmly greeted by Ellie at the front desk. We arrived about 1.5 hours before check-in, but Ellie quickly checked and found they had room available and checked us in. The room is on the small side(this is a boutique hotel in NYC), however, it’s nicely appointed and functions well. The mattress and pillows were some of the most comfortable items I’ve ever slept on. The entire room had a very hip/trendy vibe that I loved. The location speaks for itself, but it’s convenient to what felt like 100’s of restaurants and many tourist attractions. Overall, I would rate my stay at Hotel Henri as a 10/10. I can’t thank Ellie enough for her kindness and warm welcome which set the tone for our entire stay!

The folks at Hotel Henri were super kind and friendly. The hotel was clean and was in a great location for trains, grocery and restaurants. I enjoyed my stay very much. I would recommend to anyone visiting Manhattan.

My wife and I stayed at Hotel Henri in New York City for Labor Day weekend this year. We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff was kind and welcoming, the hotel room was clean, and the location perfect for our needs. The hotel puts you in a central location that is close to many attractions, restaurants, and stores. My wife and I arrived a couple hours earlier than our scheduled check-in time, however the staff worked hard to place us in our room as soon as possible. Joaquin, a staff member, was extremely kind and helpful. He would greet us each and every time we would pass through the lobby and helped answer any questions that we had. I would highly recommend Hotel Henri for anyone looking for a great experience and good customer service.

Not the nicest or cleanest place. The rooms are old and rundown. The area is pretty conveniently located, however. If given the choice, I would definitely choose a different location for higher quality rooms.

The hotel is up to date any more. Materials like carpet, elevator, corridor are used. The rooftop bar is closed each time for privat events, no access for hotel guests. In the room the shower was leaking, carpet dirty, wall lamp broken, ...Friendly people at reception desk.

There wasn’t a fridge if we brought food back, no microwave , and no room service . People like to eat when they go out of town . Or atleast order room service. The bar wasn’t even open in the hotel. We can’t even come down and have a drink besides tea and water ?

Nice neigbourhood, close to Subway stations. Clean and modern rooms. Boutique style. Friendly staff. Possibility to have a nice breakfast in hotel. The staff was also very helpful to get us a taxi to the AirPort.

I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Henri! Thanks to staff member Roy who went above and beyond to make my stay extra comfortable and inviting. Clean, quiet and beautiful rooms. I will definitely be staying at Hotel Henri on my next visit to the city!

Hotel Henri was very clean, staff was very friendly - our room was super sexy, gorgeous lighting - bed was ultra comfortable. we were a quick Uber ride to everywhere that we had planned to visit - the only critique might be that breakfast was not wonderful - hubs had bread that did not seem fresh & I could not purchase a single yogurt cup on it's on, I was told that it's only part of the full breakfast ticket - OVERALL, I would choose this hotel again & highly recommend!

Was booked into this hotel for work - Writing this for Joaquim who's been an absolute superstar during my stay! Uber's rates were crazy on the day I was checking out with Hurricane Dorian passing through. He remembered, checked-in and booked us a transfer at a much reasonable rate to JFK. And thank you for always sending packages to my room!

We enjoyed the stay. Room was not serviced on the day before checkout. I think this was an oversight. I would stay here again or recommend this hotel. Although space was limited, the hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. They went above and beyond to make your stay more comfortable.

I try to stay in smaller boutique hotels whenever possible, and though Hotel Henri is the right size, the overall feel of the hotel is more like a chain. My check-in was a mess, the maid service wasn't very good and though the staff are nice, they don't seem to have authority to make decisions or fix problems. The location is great, and I'm not totally writing them off because they may just be having growing pains, but for now I'd only stay here again if it was a great deal.

This hotel has exceptional customer service. We were helped by Joaquin and the rest of the front desk staff, who went above and beyond to make our trip comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Great location right in the heart of it and only one block from the Flatiron building. Lots of restaurants (Eataly is over the road) and all sorts of shops locally and only 15 mins walk to the high line

Prescription glasses were missing from the coffee counter in the room during our stay and never recovered after multiple inquiries. The same day the room was only partially cleaned. Spilled granola was left on the floor and the toilet was not cleaned. Also, the water bottles were not replenished as was done on previous days. Otherwise, our stay was fine.

I’m here with a friend. It is 1 am and we are unable to sleep because the hotel is hosting a super loud party on the rooftop -something they forgot to mention when we booked the room. There is no escaping the sound as the walls themselves are vibrating from the music (we are on the 8th floor of a 17 floor building. That’s how loud it is!!). I called the front desk and was informed that the party won’t end until 2:30 am. We have a long day of travel tomorrow so our inability to sleep is going to affect us. It’s horribly inconsiderate of the hotel management to decide that their hotel guests don’t need to sleep until 2:30 am and that they don’t need to be informed. Also, it’s inconsiderate of the hotel staff to not lower the volume after so many guests complained. Unless you do not mind random loud parties above your head, do not stay in this hotel. Other than that, the rooms are dark and the ac units old and too loud. This hotel should be rated 3 stars. It’s definitely not a 4 star hotel. The location is good though if your visit to NYC involves both downtown and midtown errands.

Where can I start, the room felt like a dungeun, completely dark, sleeping was almost impossible for the noises the bed made, TV signas goes on and off by itself and nobody takes care of anyting, the personal only say sorry for your incoveniences but do nothing about it. They charge a "resort fee" but there are NO AMENITIES, its a lot, I would not recomend it to anybody.

Relatively small room but not unusual for NYC. Good value for money, located between 5th and 6th ave near Flatiron and Chelsea. Only complaint was the air con, located in the room and quite noisy overnight

Very nice, clean hotel. Central location and Found it very easy to get to all the sites from this location. Located just up the street from the Flatiron building. Staff was very helpful. Would recommend to friends.

Joaquin was very courteous and made our stay very pleasant. On the day of checkout, Joaquin facilitated our ride to the airport and helped my coworkers and I carry our luggage out to the car. He had great customer service, and made my experience at hotel Henri enjoyable.

Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the restaurant and the rooftop bar. The lobby is small but inviting, the iced tea and lemonade for the guest on a hot day is a nice touch! Would definitely stay again!

Absolutely awesome. Perfect location to all my needs. Spacious and comfortable room, staff was awesome, polite, very helpful and friendly, Joaquin hooked us up with a Spanish restaurant where we ate an authentic dominican platter "MMMMMMMMMM". I will definitely stay here again .

The staff tried to meet our expectations. However, due to aged HVAC equipment could not fully resolve temperature issue, too hot. But once they removed the AC decor screen the room air flow improved and lowered the temperature by 2 degrees (cooler). Also, the shower door leaked and flooded bathroom floor, black mold in shower enclosure and the shower door handle was loose and came off a n my hand. All concerns were looked at by Engineering and a Housekeeping. But not all issues were fixed.

When I arrived in my room, my room temperature was very very cold, uncomfortably chili. I tried to adjust the temperature and thought I did. I came back to the room after heading to dinner to learn the temperature gage did not work nor did turning off the unit. It was broken. The shower leaked & was not sealed properly. The toilet was running & would not stop. Changed rooms the next day to find that shower was not properly sealed & also leaked.All & all a very upsetting experience & stay.

I only stayed here one Saturday night in August 2019 after a sleepless red-eye from CA, and really appreciated the service from the front desk staff, Yaya and JoJo, who accommodated my very early arrival without a problem. They were sweet, they smiled, and they were that kind to everyone, so Kudos to them! I asked for a quiet room and I got a quiet room! The only loud noises were the BOOMS when other guests would shut their doors, so if the hotel would suggest for guests to shut their doors gently but securely as a courtesy to other guests, that would completely eliminate the noise disturbance. My room was COOL when I arrived, as the AC had been running, and CLEAN. So important to not find other people's hair in the bathroom, etc., so Kudos to the Housekeeping Staff! The only minor bummers were: no shower cap; no shower gel -- bar soap just isn't my thing; and the shower did leak and to form a puddle along the doorway. I was just careful stepping onto the marble floor and after drying off, I laid down the towels to soak up the puddle. Back to the awesome points: Black out curtains; large flat screen TV had lots of channels to choose from, and of course there was Wi-Fi. At check-in I was given two complimentary drink tokens, (that I didn't use,) as they were going to have a rooftop happy hour, (I slept through it!) and in the lobby they had two ice cold dispensers of complimentary lemonade and ice tea with vodka and another bottle of booze, which surprised me, lol! But hey, it's Manhattan, so that made sense. I loved the lemonade. Anyway, the positives vastly outweighed any negatives and I highly recommend Hotel Henri!

I returned home last evening after a four night stay. The location can not be beat. Eataly at the end of the block, Tacombi & Bo’s Kitchen across the street, Tappo Thin Crust Pizza & Chop House out the door to the right, Trattoria Italienne and Junoon to the left, a Greek restaurant in the lobby, & drinks on the roof. There’s even a Starbucks on the corner if you’re in need of a mediocre coffee. Just around the corner from the 23rd Street/7th Avenue Subway Station to easily get you uptown and down. The hotel is in the heart of the Chelsea/NoMad area and is convenient to everything. Rooms were typical small but quirky NY hotel rooms with modern decor & updated bathrooms. Unlike other reviews, the A/C in our room did a great job in cooling our room, which was a stark contrast to the excessive heat outside. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff were warm & friendly, made small talk, greeted us each time we came in and out. No one was unpleasant. Little touches like the hydration station in the lobby (with an occasional bottle of vodka & tequila thrown in to add to your lemonade or iced tea) were much appreciated. My husband and I were standing outside melting in the heat while we consulted our map, and Antonio ran outside with cold bottles of water for us. For the low price we paid for the room, the service was exemplary. A few minor things in the room (outlets that needed tightening to the wall, chipped paint) & a slow elevator did nothing to take away from an overall great experience. Can’t imagine staying anywhere else from now on.

It was my first time stay at this hotel and it was great! My expectations were exceeded. Location is GREAT. The staff is very friendly and especially accommodating. Joaquin went the extra mile to make sure we were taken care of. Tip: hotel offers car services to the airport which was a lot better/economical than Uber. Would stay here again in the future :)

location is great, close to so many different things, hotel was nice, our king size bed room was small but nice, but the best part was the great service we received from every staff member especially joaquin! he went above n beyond for us and we would def stay again

Very nicely arranged hotel located in an incredible location that allows you to walk to almost anywhere in the city. Joaquin and the other members of the staff were always very friendly and welcoming and contributed to make our stay a very pleasant one. I would totally recommend this place for a stay in NYC.

Unhelpful staff at front desk across a number of different issues, they were not even able to advise me on routes or directions to places in the city. WiFi wouldn’t work in room. Paid extra for amenities that were not above any normal standard. Overall the hotel was the low light of my trip.

I stayed here last week and wasn't happy with the experience. Upon arrival (it was a Sunday evening around 6 pm), a great indicator of the first impression, I waited about 20 minutes to check in because they only had one person working the check-in desk. I asked if there was someone else who can help and was told no, only one person. I finally checked in and then went to my room only to see that the door was stuck and that I had to literally use my shoulder to barge into the door to open. What hotel room has that where you need to do this? Each night that I would come back my key card would not work and I always make sure that the keycard is not close to any magnets (I do a bit of travel). Each time I have to go to the front desk and get my card to work again.The AC is too loud at night. The cost for staying is a somewhat good deal, but, I'd prob look at another property.The hotel bar at the penthouse is pleasant with great views, and the staff pleasant.

Hotel Henri was extremely wonderful. Would definitely come back! The service was great, very respectful and timely. I’d recommend any of my friends and family to choose this hotel during they’re stay in Manhattan.

We stayed at this hotel for a brief business trip in New York. It's in the heart of the Chelsea/NoMad area with easy access to transportation. The hotel staff was very pleasant. They hotel has a lovely rooftop bar that never seems to be overly crowded. The rooms are average size but dark. I appreciate the hardwood floors (for those with allergies), clean bathrooms and in-room amenities - minibar, comp WiFi, iron/board, hairdryer, safe, etc. - all a good quality.

No attention to detail anymore. Booked a king bed, got 2 queens. Empty tissue box upon arrival (not a big deal but shows they don’t care. Teeth marks on one of the key cards. Biggest issue was the AC!! Wouldn’t go below 73. I called and they guy lowered the thermostat, which I told him I did. I told him it appears to work but wont actually cool the room. The set temp was at 60, and the room stayed at 74. Horrible sweaty sleepless night.

This isn't my first time in manhatten. And it was my most enjoyable hotel staying. Foodwise - two michlen restaurants are just downstairs. (Italienne has decent prices, the other one is super expensive), a great mexican place across the street and lovely smelling pizza also downstairs. At the end of the block theres Eatly (italian superstore with in site amazing restaurants and amazing products), and the Madison square park (which has the original shake shack place and generally it's lovely to have a picnick or just watch the squirrels).Pret, starbucks, and a great french bakery is in the next street, and everything is super close. Totally recommend to go to this hotel. I talked a lot about the food, but the service is great, beds are comfy, rooms are clean.

Rooms were small but quirky, booked a Sunday night staycation specifically because we knew the rooftop would be quiet. Was able to get a few drinks and enjoy the sunset without New York rooftop groupies. Tacombi across the street is a staple. Service was great, accidentally left behind some jewelry and after a stressful hour or so they called me back with the recovered item. Nicely done.

review_body: I must say Roi, the very nice gentleman behind the front desk at the hotel was awesome. When trying to decide where to eat after a show with my mother Roi provided a full list of restaurants to visit. He was very helpful with everything during my stay. Not only that but I loved the hotel and the location, there was never anything too far away. I'd definitely stay here again.

Room was good size and really tastefully decorated. Very modern and dark/romantic vibes. The hotel has a penthouse bar with a decent view. It is a great location, right by Madison square park. They offer complimentary lemonade and punches, the second day they put vodka out to go with it. Overall great experience, would stay again.

I loved the location - it was convenient and easy to get to downtown as well as uptown. And only 1 mile from the Hudson, where I enjoyed running along the Hudson River Park path. I liked the gesture of the complimentary drinks at Sir Henri but unfortunately didn't get to experience the rooftop bar due to other commitments. Staff was very friendly and the rooms were comfortable and quiet.

Comfortable, clean, and quiet room; it is also surprisingly large for New York City. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The location is great too. Close to a wide variety of excellent dining options.

We are so delighted with our stay at Hotel Henri!! The room feels spacious, clean, and modern. There is a welcome (and delicious) homemade lemonade and iced tea to have anytime. And best of all, we told them it was our 10 year anniversary and they surprised us with roses and petals on our bed, a note, and (free!) champagne! (Thanks Yaya!!!) Would recommend this to everyone. Bonus- feels like it’s close to everything!

Hotel staff, rooms and location is great. The lighting in the bathrooms needs to be better and the towels are a little rough. Apparently the bathrooms are being updated but the shower floor was chipped and you could see where the vanity had been moved. This is our 5th or 6th time staying but before it was a Wyndham Hotel. They provided free continental breakfast which we miss. Iron and coffee maker in room are a plus.

The Hotel Henri has a great location. Strategically placed on West 24th Street between Broadway and Avenue Of The Americas (6th Ave.), the Hotel Henri is a great "stepping off" point to dining, entertainment and (for me) business.I really would rate this hotel 3.8 or 3.9 but Trip Advisor does not seem to have an in between point for ratings.Sandy, the hotel manager, is a class act. When certain issues arose, she was there to "make things right". That is to be very respected in the hotel hospitality business. I like the hotel and would consider staying there again due to her management skills.

review_body: Enjoyed clean, nicely remodeled small tourist hotel. Staff is excellent and attentive. It’s New York, so rooms are small. Wonderful top floor bar is an oasis. Owners need to appreciate what a gem they own and treat staff well.

This staff is young and so efficient and happily friendly. Hotel is clean, modern and ideally located close to Penn Station and subways. The Eataly across the street is a fabulous, and expensive restaurant/grocery store. Good find !

Hotel is located in a great area near all the good stuff. If you want to experience NY's finest than you must stay here. No room service but you have all sort of places in the surroundings to eat and shop.

Hotel was located in Hells Kitchen area of Manhattan. Hotel was small but livable. Restaurant out front was very new and a bit unorganized. Rooms were neat and clean. Shower was nice. Front desk personnel was helpful and very nice. Stayed to view the Barbra Streisand concert at Madison Square Garden. Garden was about a 15 minuet walk or ten minuet uber ride. Many local eateries around hotel

Nice people. Nice rooms, environ ment is little noisy but that's NY! Overall good value for money! The people are helpfull and thecpancakes are really good.rooms are a little dusty but overall clean. Beds are confortable. Rooms a little small but enough espace to pût the stuff.

I stay at the Hotel Henri every time I'm in New York for business. Roi and the other members of the staff are the consummate professionals -- kind, professional, and always helpful! The rooms have never disappointed. The beds are comfortable, the wifi is strong, and the place, overall, is very quiet and peaceful. And, I really appreciate the free passes they provide (to all guests) for Equinox Gym. Additionally, the location is great, the outside seating area is convenient, and there's a rooftop lounge that has a great ambiance.

With a myriad of hotel selections to your disposal, it's hard to pinpoint just one that stands out from the rests, but Hotel Henri does that. Location: The hotel is located in the Flat Iron district which houses a good selection of bars and restaurants-make sure to check out Oscar Wilde a few blocks away from the hotel. It's a cool lounge with amazing craft cocktails. There's also Eataly across the street from Henri. Staff: Everyone that we met at the hotel was very nice and professional. Roi was especially nice and helped us find a few local spots to eat/drink at. Hotel/amenities: As to be expected the room wasn't huge...but if you're worried about a small room in NYC then you're doing it wrong. The bed was suuuuper soft (but not so much that you wake up with back pain). The decor was cool and very insta-worthy. There's a rooftop lounge with some good drinks. We didn't spend too much time up there, but the one drink I had was decent.Overall the stay was amazing. Again, thanks to Roi and the rest of the staff. Will def be back again.

We stood here for my friends 22 birthday and it was an amazing experience! The hotel staff was one of the best I’ve seen in New York! Joquain was also super helpful and very nice! 10/10 would recommend and go again!

After I was delayed 9 hrs due to electrical storms on the east coast, the staff at Hotel Henri was a gift from god!!From the beautiful smiles of the front desk concierge to the accommodating, selfless manager Sanday, who went out of her way to make my stay more comfortable than I could have imagined. Hotel Henri is immaculate, perfectly located and I cannot say enough about the staff! They even offer free access to Equinox gym in gramercy park while you're staying at the hotel. The rooms are big. The a/c rocks and the beds are super comfortable. The place is quiet and professional.  The roof deck is perfect for hosting private business meetings I'm going back to New York City next week and will absolutely be staying with my new friends at Henri and recommend to everyone!Cheers to you guys for killing the the hospitality game.

The Hotel was very clean and fresh. The room was spacious and the AC's worked great on a very warm day in NYC. The staff was all friendly and very helpful. Overall a great experience and I would recommend Sir Henri if you intend to stay in that area of the city.

North Palm Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: We were in NYC for business. The location was good for us and more affordable than many other hotels. The front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. Even though the room was smaller than hotels in other cities, it was nice and comfortable. I'm keeping Hotel Henri as a definite contender for next time we're in town.

We ended up at this hotel by default. We were supposed to stay at Hotel Hendricks but they didn't open on time so we were offered Hotel Henri. I must say I wasn't happy at first but what a blessing in disguise. We were greeted with smiles by everyone! Our room was ready early, like 1pm so we were psyched. Tayvon went above and beyond with all of our requests. There was nice cold lemonade and ice tea in the lobby along with Tequila & Vodka.......now I'm really starting to like this place! This was the scenario all weekend. They kept our luggage on our last day after we had checked out. Rooms were CLEAN!!! For this reason alone, I'll be back. There aren't many rooms on each floor so that was a plus. We stayed on the 17th floor and the rooftop was on the 18th. Wasn't noisy at all. There is an outdoor seating area out front where you can chill and eat/drink. ALL of the food in the Flatiron District was fabulous and inexpensive by NY standards. Lots to do in the area and some great happy hours. Will definitely stay here again and have already recommended this hotel to friends. Keep up the outstanding customer service.

By far my best stay in NYC! Hotel Henri was the perfect place to stay during the month of June for the Pride parade its location was right in the center of it all near the Historic Flatiron building in Manhattan. I loved this Hotel it was quiet clean the staff was friendly. Roi was super helpful at the front desk and made sure I had a fast check in when I arrived from a long flight from Israel! It happened to be raining in NYC when I arrived I was tired and ready for bed and he made sure I was comfortable and had a quiet room. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

I love this hotel! I’ve stayed here one time and I am definitely going back! The location is great it’s the perfect place to hide away when you’re in New York. Very clean the staff is so helpful and friendly the whole front desk crew always greeted me with a warm welcome every day, Roi at the front desk was especially helpful always very nice and always made sure I had amenities when I needed he is a great team member. There was also a bellman I believe his name was Taevon, he was super helpful and always offering a helping hand even going out of his way to hail a taxi for me. Such a great team they are!

I was looking for a boutiquey hotel, far from Times Square, close to the village and Soho with a rooftop bar and two double beds. Hotel Henri fit the bill perfectly. The room was lovely and staff accommodating. It is my new NYC hotel!

Lovely stay—was in NYC for personal family matter and the staff was excellent. The upstairs patio was lovely and the outdoor one on the street very comfortable. Great touch to ha e a cold lemonade or iced tea when returning.Will be back when it’s a fun stay!

Great stay at the Henri'..Great location there in Chelsea.. Near Madison Square Park and 'Eataly Italian Grocery'.. BUT a little frustrating to have to pay $25.00 per day 'resort' fee for NO resort. Virtually CLOSED ground floor restaurant and well overdue for make-over, worn bar set-up tucked into top floor which was 'booked out' for a private event 1st night. We were given gym passes to go off to local Equinox Gym which we made a point of taking advantage of, if only to 'redeem' our 'resort fee'. Yet an enjoyable stay. LOL

Great little hotel off the busier streets. Warm tones and contemporary decor makes the space feel like a true getaway! Definitely true to its portrayal. Staff was also exceptional and very much accommodating.

review_body: The good: Hotel Henri is in a great location. Just an easy subway ride or walk to anything you want to visit. The rooms are small, but clean. They even had a toothbrush for me in the bathroom when I forgot mine. The Bad: the showers were cold, the cable was in and out and the K cups were not replaced. The Ugly: in a city of very expensive hotel option, the Hotel Henri is clean, less expensive choice

I've never stayed in a hotel that didn't have soap in the bathroom. They had shoe polish...but no soap. And I was up late and didn't feel like calling down to the front desk for it at that hour. Especially since it turned out the door handle to the shower hadn't been tightened and just popped off the moment I tried to open it. Finally, I could hear loud conversations in the hall until well past midnight with zero sound insulation. As I was on a business trip and it was a Tuesday night, this seems...problematic.

review_body: I had an excellent stay @ the Hotel Henri. The room was clean, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Will definitely stay here again. The location is truly unbeatable and the hotel gives you access to the local equinox.

Top notch boutique hotel in NYC, Hotel Henri is terrific. Joaquin, specifically, is top notch, providing amazing service, having run across the street for a dinner menu for me upon my late night check in. The rooms are comfy, the rooftop bar is good fun, and the location can't be beat!

I was pretty unimpressed with the hotel itself, the rooms were really small and quite noisy. I had a huge rattle-y AC unit in there that could not be turned off, and I actually had to unscrew some of the light bulbs because I couldn't find the light switches for the some of the lamps.That being said, the service was really above and beyond, which is why I am rating them a 4. The building is a 3, the staff is a 5 all the way.

Clean, cute hotel In the perfect location with all my favorite restaurants in walking distance. Staff friendly and helpful. Complimentary water and coffee. Access t o a nearby gym and a beautiful rooftop bar.Kathy Gardner

This is one of my favorite hotels to stay while in Manhattan. Conveniently located in the heart of the city, my shopping and work are within reasonable distance. I'm a huge fan of the decor and room settings. In addition, flight delays and bad weather during this time of the year caused me several late check-ins. Roi at the front desk always greets me with big smile and demonstrates how accommodating the Hotel Henri staff is. Coming in from a full day of travel and getting checked in quickly with courtesy is always uplifting. In comparison to other hotels I've stayed the late check-in process goes smoothly and doesn't result in a lost room. The upstairs bar is also a nice place to bring a guest and enjoy a glass of wine. On slow nights you really feel like a VIP. The dimly lit room is great for "bourbon and a book" when your not willing to venture too far from your room. In my opinion this property is highly recommended.

Stayed one day and night..they were able to accommodate a very early check-in for us at no extra cost. Room was super modern and cool, comfortable, chill...staff was extremely pleasant. The rooftop lounge is a great perk. Me and my boyfriend had sex all day and night in the room and it was everything I could've ever asked for.

Clean room, with airconditioner. Perfect location. Close to subway. Stayed for one week. Did find a place to eat good breakfast nearbye. A little bit noicy because of a buildingplace wall-to-wall. But we did find this hotel OK anyway. Nice and friendly personal.

This hotel has it all, the location, great customer service and decently sized rooms. We stayed here for 7 nights and it was a pleasant and comfortable stay. This hotel is just steps away from the famous flat iron building. Loved the ice tea in the lobby, a nice touch and very refreshing. I would like to thank hotel henri for adding to our wonderful holiday exploring New York, specifically Sanday at reception who was more than helpful! Thanks for everything.

Hotel Henri is very central in mid Manhattan close to 23rd&6th subway. Lots of Italian restaurants nearby Eataly, L’Amico to name but two. Can’t go wrong for Subway or Starbucks. Hotel rooftop bar not cheap but great happy hour drinks daily and views are ok. Hotel lobby has ice cold drinks readily available as you walk through. I’d recommend going out for breakfast as there are plenty of eateries between 5th & 6th Ave and blocks 23 to 44. Take comfy shoes as there’s lots of walking required. Rooms are small but we were out at least 10 hours a day so it’s no issue. Prices are more than reasonable in comparison to others I looked at. Clean and comfortable and staff very helpful.

Reasonable price & perfect location, Eataly is just across the street & everything we wanted to see was just a 15 to 20 min travel by subway because Hotel Henri is right in the middle of Manhattan. Excellent hospitality, always kindly greeted every time we walked in. They even provided drinks & daily newspapers in the lobby. The room was clean, just a little tight but we expected that & was only there to sleep & get ready because there was so much to do in New York. Definitely will be staying here again in the near future.

I loved the style of the room and the location of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again when I travel to NYC. I was able to get early check in, which I really appreciated. The staff was very pleasant and very helpful with places to visit.

Perfectly located to sites and subway system and parks. Hotel staff was very pleasant. And the hotel was super clean. Great roof top bar!Only downfall, the restaurant was closed, but there are so many great options in the city, it made no difference to us.Totally recommend this hotel.

Our room was compact but very modern, clean, ideal. The staff were all very friendly, polite and helpful. It had everything you need and we felt very comfortable. The rooftop bar and balcony has a nice view and we made use of that as well.

I visited hotel Henri on Sunday July 7th and I ran into a wonderful young lady by the name of Ellie. The hotel for one was nice but she made my experience much better with the smile and great customer service she provided. I checked in the hotel pretty early and she made it her business to get me an early check in and not only that but she also had my bags in my room already when I got there. Yea you may say this was her job but She did it with a smile the entire time. Keep up the good work!

Location was great and the size of the room was perfect for two. All staff was welcoming and helpful always! We were close to a subway station which was very helpful, along with many places to eat. There also is a rooftop on the top of the hotel which was awesome! We enjoyed our time at Hotel Henri and would recommend it to anyone heading to NYC

We loved the hotel staff and the location (close to metro) and situated in the middle of Manhattan made it convenient getting around. Air conditioning worked great, room was clean (wished the beds were queen not double but size of room probably dictated that) and the staff was very accommodating always as needed!

The Hotel Henri is a great looking hotel. The rooms are super clean and modern and spacious. Be careful of the $25 charge for water and coffee. Two 12 oz water bottles and a k cup. Be sure to refuse that. You can bring in your own water and get coffee on your own as well. They charge $3 for a nasty cup downstairs but Starbucks is at the corner as well as great coffee at Eataly at the other end of the street. We had cold showers our first morning and the next evening. Some issue with the city????? I have to say they comped us the $25 a day water/coffee charge which shows that that want their customers to be happy. The bed was super comfy and the room temp was perfect. The rooftop bar is very cool - good happy hour!

I stayed a week at this hotel located in the Flatiron District and I enjoyed the quiet, hip feel of this hotel. A very friendly staff greeted me every time I entered or exited the hotel. I did not partake the bar or coffee bar but it looked like a nice place to relax, read or mingle with friends. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Hotel charges a $25/day for some hotel fee when you arrive. Doesn't leave a customer any choice but to accept it. Leaves a sour taste in my mouth. When the hotel cleans my room, they don't even give me new water bottles. I have to keep asking for it.

Staying here was so incredibly comfortable with a stylish room, incredibly friendly and helpful staff that made a business trip feel much easier due to location, amenities, access to an Equinox gym, rooftop patio cocktails and views along with a great central location.

At my arrival and after a long flight. Sanday (receptionist) was having a complicated client. It called my attention how profesional and polite she was with each of his questions and then she was able to get my room earlier even I land before check in time and manager also to check in other client that arrived after me. . She also sent me to a real nice coffee shop and restaurants that were walking distance from the hotel. I am so glad that Sanday was at the hotel during my stay. For my as bodybuilder my diet and comfort are the most important factors, The hotel was just perfect for my needs.

Great place with an amazingly friendly staff. Shout out to Ellie who made our trip special and stress free. A few little things could make it 5+ stars. Enough coffee in the room for more than one person to have regular, not decaf or tea and coffee cups without having to ask for them. There were a few other little details that could be improved upon but over all an excellent choice for a stay in NYC.

I stayed in this hotel for a business trip. The room and bathroom are clean and good sized, given its located in Manhattan. Staff are friendly. The rooftop bar is nice. The breakfast is a little basic though for the price (I paid extra for breakfast). The continental (pricier than regular breakfast) is also not worth the price.

Great location. Loved the lobby refreshments. Friendly helpful staff. Nice out front space for sitting.. Rooms are small but adequate .. Had everything one would need. But no cabinet with drawers - a second luggage rack would be helpful. Will certainly stay here again.

Quirky little hotel in a great location. Rooms are small but well appointed and the staff are much friendlier than most NYC hotel staff. I really enjoyed the location and the hotel itself so I will be back soon. Rooftop bar is fun too. I took a chance on a boutique experience and was not disappointed.

My husband and I decided to celebrate our 7th wedding anniversary in NYC. Hotel Henri is in the perfect location! It is right in midtown and within easy access to uptown and downtown. It is within walking distance to uptown and downtown if you want to get your "daily" miles! I figured my husband and I would take the subway to most locations, but after we started walking, he didn't even realize how many miles we had walked and reached our destination! I have to say, I'm very proud of him for walking as much as we did! The staff at Hotel Henri was really great and attentive. They always greeted us when we walked in and out the door. The rooms are clean and well kept. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and we would definitely come back and stay again! Thank you Hotel Henri for a great first trip to NYC for my husband!

The buildout is small, but rooms are a good size for NYC and modern. Rooms are dark, especially in the morning (nice for sleeping in, if you can!). Quiet, modern and comfortable. It was a nice stay and was my second time there.

Yes. the rooms are small! it's NYC - it's to be expected. but the room was clean, (my main initial concern), and bright and airy. had a bit of a view - but not backed into a wall like some other places! the staff were really nice and accommodating. it has a roof top bar - small but a nice meeting spot for friends you're trying to see in a hurry. great location! quick taxi ride anywhere! and it's across the street (literally) from Eately!! great roof top restaurant there! we had 3 adults in one room - so maybe that's why it felt small :) - but it worked. we stayed for 4 nights.

This hotel was reasonably priced (for NY) clean, stylish but tight. No room to store luggage or clothes except for tiny closet that is not deep enough for hangers to hang properly and close the closet. But it was Perfect location for exploring. Short ride uptown or downtown if you know your way around. Close to subway and Wholefoods for room goodies. Staff were very kind and helpful

Poor and inconsiderate customer service, dirty hotel rooms and inability to communicate between their own staff members. Do not stay here, you will be highly disappointed - A waste of money. Our room had bloodied bedding, stained pillowcases, bloody tissues on the bathroom floor and blood on the bathroom wall when we arrived - The staff were unable to provide us a new comforter to sleep with because ‘they were out.’ So we slept with a sheet only. We were promised a complimentary bottle of wine for the dirty room and lack of provided bedding and never received it because, they too, were out. Unacceptable and poor standards.

Never coming back to the Hotel Henri. Though we've stayed here regularly when in NY this was the last time as they've now imposed a scam $25 per day charge that gets you a couple of bottles of water and passes to a gym that's 4 blocks away (assuming you even want to work out). They should be ashamed to engage in this practice and travelers should just go elsewhere. (on a side note, the front desk staff seem oblivious to the fact that the hotel name is French and keep calling it the Hotel "Henry").

So I booked a room on the Hotel's actual website (not Orbitz, Travelocity etc etc) and it gave me a total of $398 including taxes and fees. I completed the process and got a confirmation e-mail from the hotel with the same number. On the day of check-out I received a bill that was $50 more because of a "facility fee." I went to the front desk to dispute this. First they asked how I booked the trip (whether Orbitz or other) and I had to show them the e-mail from their own site with the price. Then they proceeded to tell me that they don't apply it until check-in. I told them that's not my problem, I approved $398 with my credit card not $450 and the confirmation said $398 AFTER taxes and fees not BEFORE. After much hesitation, and a line forming behind me, she reluctantly gave me a "one time courtesy" of removing it from the bill. This poor woman who was checking in, as I was dealing with my bill, got a big long explanation of the "facility fee" and she was clearly taken aback at the fact that her bill was going to have an additional $200 ($25 a night night) applied. I told the girl, who was dealing with me, the only reason the other clerk just did that is to put on a show for my benefit. I will say that the hotel itself is nicely located, the rooms are cute and the iced tea and lemonade available all day in the lobby is a nice touch, however, those items do not conceal the fact of a shady business practice of applying a mysterious fee after the fact.

If dark, cold and slightly humid dungeons are your thing, you should request to stay in room 207. Even on a bright and sunny day, when birds are singing and the kids are playing outside, not a sliver of sun can sneak into the small window of room 207 overlooking a large, industrial-looking structure in the courtyard. I just wish they'd accessorized the room with some whips and chains.

This was my first time staying at this boutique style hotel. It was conveniently located near a subway and many upscale restaurants. The staff is simply amazing and went above and beyond to make our stay very pleasant. There were a few opportunities logistical and regarding my experience in the hotel. The restaurant was closed we were not aware. Additionally, we could hear the people above us, and next room to us as well. I would recommend some sound proofing because even when they weren’t talking loud, my husband and I were able to clearly hear them.

The rooms and bed are small but remodeled and clean. (Unless you ask for a king bed) The people at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. On a rainy day they offered us umbrellas to borrow. There are covered tables out front that you can sit at. We sat there to talk, eat, and wait for our ride. There’s a little bar on the roof also.

Good hotel with a nice top floor lounge and view in the Flatiron District. Loved the location steps away from Madison Square Park. Steps away from Blue Smoke barbecue and the excellent Jazz Standard (which I went to twice during my four night stay).

I stayed for one night because I had a work related class in mid town - I didn’t have much time but wanted to be comfortable - the The Henri was perfect! Location was great - good restaurants right down the street and Madison Square park close by - the young women st the front desk were delightful and the room was just what I needed.

Stayed in this hotel with a friend on our trip to NYC. The location was as good as we expected with good connections to all directions and a lot to offer nearby.The hotel itself was good, service good ans in general nothing to complain. Our smaller problem with the window on arrival was taken care of quickly and nicely.The rooms are not big as you can expect in Manhattan but everything worked, the bed was good and room reasonably quiet. The only bothering noise was the elevator pling once it arrived to our floor, which could be a bit more settle.The only small disappointment was the rooftop bar, where the “terrace” was non existent. Would definitely consider staying here again.

We happened upon this hotel online, and so glad we did! it was exactly what we needed. Not too small, enough room for 2 people and they have complimentary use of umbrellas which we needed because it rained for 2 days. It was in a great location and walking distance to alot of NYC. Will definitely visit again.

We stayed st Hotel Henri for proximity to Kleinfelds Bridal. Unfortunately, it was quite far to all other attractions, so needed to Uber everywhere!! Rooms and beds were very small, but only slept and got ready, so that’s OK, I guess. Rooftop bar was nice, but nearly $20 a drink!!

Great friendly service.. very convenient right in the middle of Manhattan.. unfortunately you will miss a great breakfast restaurant.. luckily there is of course a lot of restaurants very close to.. can I recommend the hotel.. absolutely yes

I stayed here for two nights and having stayed in a variety of hotels in New York for business over the years I have to say that I’ve now found a place I would book again in a heartbeat. The reason is the front of staff our so friendly, the rooms are clean and tidy, all very modern and best of all is the free daily pass to the nearby Equinox Gym which is awesome if you need a workout whilst away. It’s not a plush 5 star hotel with all the trimmings but if you’re looking for a great location, very clean hotel that is 4 star I would say then this is great value for a mid range cost hotel.

The Henri is a small hotel on 24th between 6th and Madison Park. It has just lost it’s affiliation to Wyndham. I booked on the American website and went for the higher rate as I had read the reviews which spoke about the small rooms. First, the good things: very responsive staff ( our room was changed when we told the staff the bed sagged), great location, plenty of good restaurants close by, wonderful neighborhood. We booked because of price which was a good rate. Things to consider when booking: be aware that all the rooms are the same no matter the price(we booked a deluxe king and did not receive all the listed amenities and the size of the room was no larger than the « standard » room-but there are 3 balcony rooms), beds are not great, passable but not great, very little breakfast options in the hotel, cleaning was not adéquate ( our trash cans were not emptied but the beds were made), no drawers for clothes storage, closet very narrow, so much so that coat hangers had to be turned on an angle to close the door.

We stayed at Hotel Henri over Memorial Day weekend. The price and location are excellent! The room (1606) was small, but given the pricepoint, to be expected. We could hear people waiting for the elevator in the mornings, but besides that, it was a quiet hotel.

Free Eauinox membership while staying there. 10/10. Unlimited Poland Springs water. Keurig in the room. Great rooftop bar. Quality restaurant at the hotel. Hard working and friendly staff. Great location. Nothing more needs to be said.

Used to stay here when it was Wyndham Garden Chelsea and this is my first time as Hotel Henri. Renovations are nice. At first glance my room seemed serviced by housekeeping, but I found a small pill on the floor of the bedroom and a used tampon in the wrapper at the top of my bathroom trash can. When I called down I received an offer for someone to come empty my trash can, which I declined. No apology or surprise at all with my complaint. When I restated my complaint I was asked if I needed more waters or towels.

Last time I came to NYC I started at Yotel for $99/night. The space was small, had everything I needed (including wifi), I didn't expect much.This time I stayed at Henri for $350/night. The room was as small as the cheap 'pod' at Yotel, I had to pay $25 extra per day for two mini water bottles & wifi. A light was broken in my room. Someone else's food was still in my refrigerator.

I stayed in the hotel for a week and not once the swiped/vacuum the room floor and also the corridors carpets. I never saw a cleaning person the whole time i stayed there. They did fixed the bed but not much more.They are charging "resort fee" of 25$ tax not included per night for the wifi and gym which you must pay, outrageous. The air conditioner was very noisy.Hope not to get there again

Perfect size room with good lighting. Really Clean, great location and price. Great staff. The hotel is centrally located, you can visit Madison Square and the Farmers market. Plenty of dining options, endless options. The hotel also offers very affordable food. Take advantage of the rooftop, drinks and good vibes.

I got a room for the weekend, 3 months in advance. I know that hotel rooms in NYC, especially boutique hotels, are shoe boxes. so I got a deluxe (read: normal) hotel room for my mom, and a PREMIERE deluxe (read: larger, with private balcony, higher floor) for myself and my wife. I reserved this directly from the hotel website, not from a 3rd party travel site. I have a confirmation email with both rooms, showing one being 50 dollars a night more than the other, and laying out clearly that one is premiere and bigger with a balcony. I go to check in, and the desk clerk claims her system doesn't show a room upgrade. it sure shows that I am paying more for one room though. The unhelpful clerk acts as if I'm bothering her that they aren't honoring my reservation. Pretend you reserved a fancy dinner at a patio table for six, 3 months in advance, and when you get to the restaurant, the host doesn't understand why you are upset that they've reserved you a two top by the bathroom. So after pulling teeth, the desk clerk agrees to at least credit me the difference since I am overpaying now for a normal room. guess what? it's now 3 days after I've checked out, and there is no credit on my card for the difference. Add to this that the rooms are on floor 9-17 and one of two elevators was out of service all weekend, with 10 plus minute waits for the one working elevator. at least we walked off our dinners by climbing up and down 9 flights of stairs. This place is pretending to be much nicer than it is, there are plenty of boutique hotels in NYC that actually honor their own reservations and don't act like the customer is the problem when it is clearly them.

I was two weeks with them and I loved the place! It’s very centric and the people is friendly and attemptive.The room was big and clean, and the restaurant with Greek food was delicious. It was our second time there.

Small but adequate and clean. Closet. Coffee or and K-pods. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice location near subways. Flatiron and Chelsea district. Several restaurants and shops around area. Not too noisy.

The hotel is located right in Flatiron and within walking distance to union square. The hotel staff was also very nice but our room left a lot to be desired. It was dreary and dated looking. The bed was sunken in and super soft. There was one window in the room which wasn’t properly sound proofed and didn’t have proper black out shades. For $300 plus a night I would’ve expected a bit more

Beautiful hotel and brilliant location. We had a lovely week here and the bed was so comfortable. The room was clean and the facilities were great. The only one problem for tourists to be aware of is that you have to pay $100 deposit when you arrive and they don’t accept cash. The lady on the front desk when we arrived was very rude but all the other staff were lovely. There wasn’t a view from our room (901) but we didn’t mind.

My husband and I were visiting the city and decided to stay at Hotel Henri. We were pleasantly surprised at how friendly the staff was and the decor, cleanliness and the comfort of our room. We will definitely stay there again!

King bed was comfortable; nice vanity items; very friendly and helpful front desk staff;The inlcuded breakfast was a sit down and order; not a buffet that you could choose your own. With limited time we would have preferred a quicker option

I realize that Henri is a rather boutique hotel and the rooms are small, but at least give us a closet that can accept a hanger with the door closed. The bathroom floor was filthy and the restaurant never seems to be open except for a self serve, stale, day(s) old Danish. we walked to stabucks for coffee. Our stay was in 1603, and was not worth $308.00 per night.

I booked this hotel months in advance for my husband's birthday, selecting a package that included king size-bed and breakfast for two. Since I made my reservation so early, I had numerous choices in hotels and picked Hotel Henri because of the package. However, when I arrived the hotel had no record of the package. I was told that I had booked a double bed. Luckily, I was able to pull up my copy of the reservation that clearly stated I had booked a king. They changed my reservation and I was given a room on the 12th floor. I asked about breakfast for two but this wasn't acknowledged. I figured that I just had to show my key but stopped by the front desk to confirm later that evening. Once again, the front desk had no record of the package. I had to pull up my confirmation that clearly stated I had breakfast for two included. Only then did I receive a complementary continental breakfast pass. As for the hotel, as others had mentioned it is a nice location. The rooms are small but adequate and contemporary in design. The following morning we woke to pouring rain. We went to breakfast around 8:30 a.m. only to find out that they had run out of food. How can a hotel run out of food? We had to go out in the pouring rain to find a place to eat. My overall rating was poor because the location did not make up for small rooms and lack of knowledge of terms of booking I picked this hotel because of the package but the hotel had no knowledge of it. Had I known, I would have selected another hotel.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room sizes are smallish, but that's to be expected in Manhattan. Complimentary breakfast was continental, very limited, but I enjoyed toasted bagel with cream cheese. Horrible coffee. Starbucks very close. lol Very happy with the ambiance of the hotel, and its great location near the Flatiron Building, Eataly, etc. Just a 15-minute walk to the Empire State Building, and most other sight-seeing is walkably close too. Otherwise, subway is just over a block away.

I travel to New York regularly for work and have never found my go to hotel. Then I stumbled upon Hotel Henri for a last minute booking and I don't plan to go elsewhere.I love a hotel with hardwood floors because you know it is clean. I slept like a rock and the bathroom was clean -- gotta love a robe and slippers!Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. So cheery and professional. Honestly, I just loved my stay here.

We stayed for our anniversary. The rooms were clean, the staff was great! We stayed in the king with the balcony. The bed was comfortable. The hotel is located right across from Eatily. I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is very clean, nice sized rooms and a cool bar at the top and bottom of the hotel. It is close to EVERYTHING! Dont pass on this place. You will not regret it. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we were greeted everytime we came in and out.

Hotel was very nice. Our room was too small for 4 people but we made do for two nights. Knowing we registered as four people why do they give only three bath towels? ?. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Jeffrey M
Toms River, New Jersey

review_body: We stayed there 5 times in 2 years... It's a very nice place to stay and area! In the middle of every thing... It's also really quite as soon as we are in our room! The lounge on the top is a must...GO!

The Henri is a good property in a great location. The rooms are decorated in a fun way but are quite small. Bathrooms are clean and in good shape. The rooftop lounge is fun. Staff is friendly and we love being close to Chelsea, Village, Hi-line etc

Reason I am giving this a 3 star is because a support column was right in the walking path in the room made it hard to navigate. Other than that the room was great. Was a little noisy from other people staying there as well. Door slamming all night. I enjoyed the balcony at 16 floors up. I loved the bed. Staff was very courteous and willing to help you.

Coming from out of town, we had lots of questions. The staff was always kind, upbeat, and helpful. They helped us understand the metro system. They gave us ideas of places to eat. And they made our stay very comfortable. And our room was clean and cozy. We would come again!

We booked here using our Wyndham rewards points, and were happy with the location and hotel. Rooms were smaller than most places we’ve been, but hey, it’s NYC. We would definitely stay here again. Lots to see nearby.

The room was very comfortable and the staff was incredibly friendly. Located in a great part of the city and only about a 20 minute walk to the "touristy" areas. Real estate is a hot commodity here so there were only two elevators which took awhile to get. I'd highly recommend staying on a lower level if they give you the option. The drinks at the rooftop bar were great, but I wouldn't rely too much on the word "rooftop". It's more of a small balcony than anything. It's a great view, but there's no tables or seating area outside.

This hotel is located a block from the Flatiron Building near Fifth Avenue and 24th Street. The location is very convenient being walking distance from Penn Station, very near subway access and walking distance or a short cab ride from many areas of midtown and downtown Manhattan.The hotel itself is quite comfortable and the hotel staff are friendly and very accommodating. There is not much of a lobby as it is a rather small hotel but for us that was of no consequence. The rooms was on the small side but not cramped and the bathrooms were reasonable and clean. And the rates were quite reasonable for Manhattan hotels.If you are looking for luxury, this is not your place. If you are looking for comfort, location, convenience, and reasonable cost, then you should check it out. A nice, relatively small boutique style hotel.

Lovely hotel in the Chelsea Area of NYC. I t is clean and convenient to Madison Sq. Park where there is a Shake Shack outdoor restaurant. The rooms, although smallish and clean and the added amenities of a Bathrobe and slippers. The bathroom lighting could be used more efficiently

What a great little hotel. Everyone was extremely nice. Rooms are a little small but you are in New York. Beds were super comfy and the location was awesome. In a week long stay there were issues for 4 days with one of the elevators that was a little frustrating but you could see the staff and the management were on top of it trying to rectify the situation. I will be going ba k

Me and my Gal go here 5-6 weekends a year. Excellent rooftop for drinks, ambiance and happy hour food. We get our Citibikes at the corner and Italeatery with 7 restaurants from breakfast to a steak restaurant is a few feet away. The staff had always been exceptional too. Now the bad news. They are leaving the Wyndam family. I only use Wyndam. Enjoy NYC

I would have rated this hotel with 5, except that there where hidden costs that where very shady... they charge about $25 USD per night for a hotel fee (Water, Coffe, Gym, etc) which seems pretty unfair specially when i made the reservation i actually read alll the fine print and there was no mention of this fee. Aside fromt this the hotel has very clean rooms, although small but the don´t feel to cramped, besides everything in NYC is small. For the price you pay you can´t get a better location.

Great boutique hotel and comfortable room. I have stayed her twice and it remains my go-to when I need to be in this part of town. Very convenient. Lighting in the room always seemed low to me but this room had more lighting. Close to the Peloton Studio as well for those wanting to go there and ride.

We had a pleasant stay, the check in was very efficient and gave us the room early, we came from a red eye trip and that was greatly appreciated. Beds should be improved as well as the housekeeping.Standard size room for NYC. Did not eat at the hotel. Check out fast and easy. Will probably come back, good places to eat nearby.

I just came back from NY, and once again I've stayed at the Henri. Although it seems it has gotten even more popular - lots of success, apparently - it has mantained its super cool, cozy and welcoming vibe, which is what made it stand out to begin with.Front desk is always super nice and accomodating - Dayhana and James were amazing - while the rooms have everything you need in a small, well designed space.Recommended!

Very nice room, to include a really nice bathroom. Front desk staff very friendly. Windows thin in room and this a little loud, especially for the 11th floor. Breakfast was a 1 star- very bad coffee, limited continental style food...bananas were good though.

We booked this hotel for a five night stay in New York for three of us. There were two double beds in the room. Normally a Wyndham Hotel has 5 foot doubles but these were only 4 foot 6, so a bit of a squash compared with what we're used to, but OK. Very comfy beds and pillows, anyway. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was excellent. Communication with the hotel beforehand was difficult, as I emailed to make an enquiry and a Dayhana Cobles eventually replied but only answered half the query, then when I wrote to her again, I never got a reply at all. Other people I know who have stayed here have said the same thing, that email contact beforehand is very poor. I had informed Dayhana that it was my daughter's 21st, so I was hoping there would be a 'happy birthday' for her when we arrived, but there wasn't. Half way through our stay, they wrote to us asking how it was going, so I said I was disappointed about the birthday being ignored and that evening a bottle of cava in a bucket of ice was left in our room. Unfortunately we got back quite late and all the ice had melted, plus we weren't quite sure it was for us and not a mistake, but the thought was there! The one down side about the hotel was there was a grid outside over a drain which was loose. I noticed it the first day but assumed they would fix it but the next day I managed to step out of a taxi and walk onto it so that it tipped up and I had quite a bad fall onto my knee. The staff were helpful and brought me some ice for my knee and they asked if they could call an ambulance. The receptionist asked me about it every time I went by after that, so they were caring about it, although I couldn't help thinking it was because they were worried I might sue! Hopefully they will now get the grate fixed in place properly. Anyway overall we enjoyed our visit and the location was excellent for visiting New York, so I would recommend it.

The Henri is trying, and the staff is very caring, but the hotel is just bad. The tiny (expected for NYC) rooms are not helped by the faux stage decor--it is not a place you want to spend any more time than you have to, and Wyndham cheaped out on the soundproofing--you can hear everything going on in the next room. But back to the puke in the elevator--we stayed over a weekend, and the rooftop bar (not anything special) is apparently a haven for 20-somethings from the suburbs--which is not conducive to a small hotel vibe. We returned from a night out at 1:30 am, and one of the 2 elevators was out. Not a problem, if you're only serving hotel rooms, but there's the rooftop bar to deal with. So the elevator is super slow, and when it finally gets to the ground floor, it opens up, and a load full of inebriated college kids comes out, and it stinks in there, because someone puked. The hotel staff quickly mopped it up, but with no other elevator option, that was not the most enjoyable way to finish an evening. Basically, this hotel is a good cheap option in a great location, which is why it is loud, cramped, and puked on. We will not be returning.

Clean, comfortable and convenient to conquering NYC. You can walk to fabulous restaurants and sites in a safe centrally located neighborhood or take the subway and in just minutes be in the middle of the highly popular tourist spots. Down to earth and friendly Hotel Henri far exceeded my expectations considering the fact that I am a former NYer,

This small boutique hotel is located near the lovely Madison Square Park in the Flatiron neighborhood. It is convenient to Greenwich Village and Chelsea, as well as numerous subway lines. The rooms are small but well-decorated. The charming lobby has the feel of a NYC apartment building, with friendly and welcoming staff. We will make this our home away from home!

Chapel Hill, North Carolina

review_body: This is a funky place, with rooms decked out in blacks, grays and reds. There is nothing elegant about it - tiny rooms, tiny closets, poor service (used toiletries in my bathroom when I arrived, coffee capsules not replaced), tiny shower, noisy heater/AC, smells coming in from the hallway... and a tin that said "Lovers' Kit" sitting next to the coffee machine, with... well, you know. I didn't see any maids, but I saw a couple of 20 somethings clearly working there, wearing all black, earrings and piercings everywhere, tattoos and generally looking fit to make anyone feel comfortable. They were polite, surprisingly enough. The bed was comfortable enough, though. Given the hotel's location (Chelsea used to be pretty seedy back in the day) and that it is NYC, I guess it is okay, overall. But if you plan to spend any time in the hotel, and comfort is important, look to other places.

The lobby and rooms look very modern and hip. Rooms are clean but very small and cramped.Location was good and close to attractions. Bed was very uncomfortable, they felt like they were old with new sheets. Stay away from rooms by the elevator or you will not sleep that night.
