Chris F
East Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: The hotel was perfectly located, the staff was courteous and helpful. The gym they included was one of the best. I am a stand up comedian was in New York City for four appearances. The front desk helped me find my way around using the subway... and walking.

Very friendly staff, the room was alright- a bit too dimly lit as there wasn't much natural light, and kind of annoying with the many light fixtures that were placed around the room separately, but other than that the room was comfy (great bed) and did what I needed it do for a business trip.

they charged me way more than I was supposed to pay after a mistake in the reservation from their side. Very frustrated. Don’t do reservation through their website. The room was good, but I paid a lot

Great stay, Good hotel. Fast check in, beds are comfortable & everything you could need is provided. Front desk was very polite. Rooms are small but very comfortable. Not a walking trip from Penn station as well. Would definitely stay & recommand this hotel!

I researched Hotel Henri and was very excited to stay there during a recent solo trip to NYC. Long story short, my reservation didn’t go through (user error, not their fault). I was oblivious to this when I tried to check in and then frantically realized I didn’t have a reservation— and the hotel was sold out. Ronni at the front desk went above and beyond for me, helping me find a great room at Henri’s sister hotel a few blocks away (which was wonderful). She was patient, kind and reassuring to a non-guest who she didn’t have to help. I’m so grateful to Ronni for her assistance and help finding a place to stay. When I’m in the city next, I’ll be sure to confirm my stay here!

After 5 weeks of attempting retrieval of personal property, with multiple phone calls, unreturned promised calls/emails, and 2 impromptu visits to retrieve it, there is no adequate acceptable answer to my property. The Director of Operations, Sanday, personally looked herself in one section, but her explanation and lack of responsibility of the hotel was not acceptable. I am a distributor of the product and can tell that a look-a-like item packaged with a part that went only with my model indicated the items had been manipulated. Refusing any responsibility because hotel policy is strict, was her reason. Result? Lost trust. Lost customer. As a Gold member of the Wyndham Hotels, I am extremely disappointed. All left items should be retrievable and one should be able to trust the hotel!
user_name:
Valerie B
Point Pleasant, New Jersey

review_body: I had a great time at The hotel. Thank you to Rani and the team. Definitely my first choice hotel when I visit New York. Great service, spacious rooms and excellent location. Close to Times Square, Empire State and easy acces to subway.

Centrally located to all the things! The pictures were a little deceiving as to the size of the rooms, and i could have *sworn* I booked a city view, not the "Spiderman View," but other than that it was a great stay. My only real complaint was the ice maker was on the bottom floor and there were only two bottles of water, but the staff was more than accommodating in bringing more ice and water.

I have never stayed in NYC and I wasn't expecting much. When I checked in I was greeted by the most amazing person. Roni was so pleasant and Upbeat and her smile was infectious. She made my check in a experience one that I will never forget. Roni made sure that I was not near the top floors due to noise form the Bar or too close to the noise from the street. She picked a great room and I heard noting other than people in the hall.Her co-worker at the time Diana was also very pleasant and a great attitude. Every time I went by the desk these ladies always made a point to say hello and ask how things were going. I need directions to a bar and Roni printed it off and got me on my way. Diana suggested a great place to eat next door. Chop Shop. Great food.If I needed anything for my room they would have it sent within 5 minutes. Amazing service. Everyone working there had a great attitude. But Roni really stood out and I cannot say enough about her.

We stayed at the Hotel Henri near Washington Square in NYC for two nights with our two teenagers and were pleasantly surprised. While the room was smaller than other Wyndham hotels we've stayed at, it wasn't a problem, as the beds were really comfortable and the location was ideal for touring nearby colleges and sightseeing. Ronni helped us prior to and during our stay regarding parking, which was very convenient and discounted, and just down the street. The concierge (we can't remember his name) was really helpful when we checked in and guided us to places to eat nearby, and Sanday was great helping us check out and take care or our logistics when we checked our bags for a day of sightseeing after checking out. If you are looking for a very nice, quiet hotel away from the hustle and bustle of NYC with great service we recommend the Hotel Henri!

There are so many little things keeping this hotel from receiving a 4 Star rating. Most are maintenance related, but some are food and beverage related. The location is perfect and the rooms are clean and comfortable, though a bit small. I have stayed here twice but came away frustrated that many seemingly small things are overlooked. I reported many of these things after my first visit but found the same problems on my last visit, even in a different room. Breakfast is included but consists on nothing more than a bagel, OJ, and coffee. A protein item, even a hard boiled egg or yogurt, should be included. Both bars close way too early, even on weekends. These things are so easily fixed and would make Hotel Henri a 4 Star property.

My stay at this hotel was extremely disappointing I spend aprox 200 to 220 days a year in hotels..... My room was never made up on Monday I departed room in am and returned aprox 3 pm and room was not done departed at 4pm and returned at 7pm and still not made up Tried the roof top bar Monday night sat there for 20 min and no waiter seen, I had to go find one it was like I was disturbing them Pretty disappointed at when in bed that you can hear other room occupants using the bathroom knowing what there doing .. very poor noise insulation The Television kept going black loss of channel many channels not available just black screen loss of signal......

Right where I needed it to be, in Chelsea. Central to My daughters apartment and the galleries on west 24th street down just a bit. This boutique hotel, with a small Rodos restaurant and an outdoor one as well were charming. Room worked for two women, everything I asked for was immediately handled. Ask for the wonderful Andy! Price was just great, breakfast available as well. A great small hotel with rooftop bar.

Henri seems like a repurposed Kimpton that will probably need updating in five years, but it does have a fun, boutique feel. The rooms are small, as expected, but comfortable. The best part is the staff. I've never experienced a friendlier group of people--very helpful and upbeat--even the guy who had worked all night and whose replacement was late. He was still super-friendly.

Excellent choice for staying in NYC! Very conveniently located, quiet, no substantial street noise, spacious room for city standards. We would definitely come back here. My only disappointment was with breakfast - overpriced for limited choice - nothing but bagels (and one morning, stale chocolate cake) and beverages (though the herbal tea was excellent)

Stayed for 2 nights, very good service, people at the front desk extremely nice, great location and rooms. Room was good, could be more tables or something to lay your clothes and stuff on. Recommend this hotel

The staff did not meet up to the expectations when it comes to service. On the day of check out three different people knocked at my door even though it was still before 11:30 (check out at 12). I forgot my shirt when I changed to a different hotel (that was much better and also cheaper) so I called 30 mins after I left to notify them. They said that they would email me when they found it. Never got an email and when I called the next day they still said that “they were working on it”. I ended up just going there and look for it myself and finally I got it back. The cleaning could also have been better. I left my pajamas on the bed and when I came back they had put it on the dirty floor under the radiator - why would they do that? Also, even though I stayed at the 17th floor the window was like it didn’t even existed, completely blocked, which left the room in darkness. Please consider the above things before booking this hotel.

JuliaSthlm
Mexico City, Distrito Federal, Mexico

review_body: The staff greeted us warmly from the moment we walked through the doors. They were very helpful and eager to answer any question we had, no matter how “touristy” it was. Ronnie at the front desk was very kind and funny and made us feel like we knew her from back home. The rooms were nice and clean and had a decent view. I would definitely stay here again!

The staff at the Hotel Henri was courteous and pleasant from minute one! Our room was ready at 1:00 pm well ahead of expected check in time which helped us rest a bit before hitting the streets again. This location was a perfect walking distance to our desired activities...Chelsea market, Greenwich Village, Eataly and Peloton! We also walked home from the theater after our show! The room was comfortable, shower strong and bed super comfortable! It is also a quiet hotel which is unusual when I usually stay in midtown area. I would return!...

I stayed at Hotel Henri for a 7 day business trip. Great location, close to Starbucks, various Grocers & Trader Joes for quick lunch / breakfast shopping. Ronni on the front desk was particularly amazing and super helpful with all my questions. They gave me a late check out which was brilliant to align with my late afternoon flight. Really enjoyed my stay here!

First time in Ney York and didn't know what to expect but hotel staff made the experience with their assistance and smiling faces Like all of the Wynyard properties we use the staff go out of the way to ensure your experience is precious

The Hotel is beautiful. In a very historic part of city. Perfect location for early city travel. Front staff was best part. Everyone is so friendly, helpful and happy to help. Munchie you are a juel. Thanks fir the great experience!!!

And there are no hangers and no work space in the room. Perhaps I'm not the target demographic. The lights in the bathroom were literally salon blinding bright. Not a good thing for the weary traveler. Perhaps if your here to see, be seen or party this is the spot for you. If your looking for a business hotel. This ain't it

The staff is friendly and courteous. The room is small but adequate,and finally a hotel with enough electric outlets!. The shelf at the side of the bed held a CPAP safely. An added benefit: night lights on both sides of the bed.I am a big fan of this hotel.

My stay was a week ago , the hotel was in the perfect location so close to everything, Great bar, room and service. Please add a real breakfast or at least more than oatmeal packets , water, coffee and a banana /apple

My boyfriend and I were in the city for a concert at Irving Plaza and stayed here. The hotel is in a convenient spot with less than 20 min walks to Irving Plaza, Greenwich Village, etc. and with plenty of nice places to eat and drink right near it. It’s also right across from Tacombi which is one of our favorite taco places in the city! The room was clean, the bathroom was nice, and the bed was very comfortable.

High end hotel at a great price. Clean, cool atmosphere. Only docked a point because little things- one of our lights didn’t work, the cleaning staff took our washcloths and forgot to add more, there was tape on the wall from a previous guest, we could hear everything in the hall as if it was in our room. Other than that the decor is nice, the staff (though a little flustered) was extremely nice and accommodating. Shower is warm and powerful. The rooms are small, but that’s New York.

I booked this hotel a few months ago since we were celebrating our friends’ 50th birthdays a block away. Very trendy, great location and a reasonable price. Loved the decor. Our room was supposed to have a king bed but had 2 double beds instead. James at the front desk told us they did not have any more rooms with king beds and that we were upgraded to this room because it was more spacious. We were clearly not happy with this situation. The manager of the restaurant Rodos in the lobby overheard and told us to come to the bar later for complimentary drinks. When we got to the room James called and told us they were sending up 4 complimentary drink tickets for the rooftop bar and also for a continental breakfast. Our room “facility fee” was also removed. We were very pleased with how the situation was addressed. The only disappointment was when we got downstairs for breakfast at 10:10 am there was nothing but coffee. Nevertheless we would still return to this hotel for the location, cleanliness, and value.

Hotel was very nice and comfortable, the staff went above and beyond to make sure we got everything we needed. They provided very helpful tips and suggestions to us for the city and how to navigate as well as good places for breakfast and lunch. They also made sure we were all set with our transport

I have never encountered a hotel experience as horrendous as my stay with Hotel Henri. The staff is rude, uninformed, and apathetic. The amenities are subpar, and the walls are paper thin. The mattress sagged in the middle and the bed frame creaked loudly with even the slightest movements. If you’re unfortunate enough to have a reservation on a night during which the rooftop bar is hosting a private event, be forewarned: the hotel does not care that they DJ will play music loud enough to shake your walls and bed until well after midnight. Additionally, be sure to read your check-out statement very carefully, and watch for additional charges to your credit card for at least a week after you leave because the hotel will charge you for mini bar items and then never send you a receipt. In short, avoid Hotel Henri at all costs.

Room clean. Staff excellent. Bed comfortable and supportive. Fine for 1 max 2 nights.Couple of complaints.1) The desk chair is inadequate and flimsy especially for a larger person. Also besides that flimsy chair the only other place to sit in the room is the bed. The staff was great and brought a better chair to my room.2) Shower - water flow is abysmal. Could barely clean soap and shampoo from body and hair. Recommend you add hand held extension or increase water flow. The adjustable head was useless (1 working setting).3) Location of coffee maker on far side of bed with barely enough room to squeeze by bed to access it. Should have been located on counter above mini fridge.

My wife and I had a long weekend in NYC to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed at the Hotel Henri. We loved it! Great location. Can walk to anything. Would stay there again. Christiaan took care of us! Thanks Christiaan!

Lovely hotel in an excellent location for sightseeing. Good size room and bathroom, compared with other hotels in NYC. Nice rooftop penthouse bar too. Close to Times Square, easy access to subway and only 45 mins max from JFK (83 dollars with tip). However, beware of getting charged on checkout for mini-bar items not used. But hotel removed from our bill when challenged straight away. Also beware, facility charge and tax, so price you see may not be price you pay!

Clean room. Comfortable bed. Friendly staff. Spacious bathroom. Not much desk room for laptop. Enjoyed having restaurant in hotel. Location is pretty good. Eataly is across street which was a benefit would stay again

The Henri is a little gem. Conveniently located, a friendly staff and rooms that are abnormally spacious. Could only be improved by offering some type of breakfast fare for business travelers on the go.

Earbuds were taken from room while out for the day. Bed sagged heavily to the center in room 1601. Elevators are unusually slow. Other than that it was a nice hotel with a great location. If you lock your things up you should be ok. They do have lock boxes in the closet on the floor. Best of luck to those willing to risk it!

New York City, New York

review_body: My first time using this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone. Staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Location is number one and the beds were comfortable with a decent sized bathroom and shower. Only negative was something out of hotels control and that was many different noises coming from within and without during the night. I will bring earplugs next time.Also the price was very reasonable, especially for the location.

Looking forward to a restful evening with my daughter and granddaughter after seeing Frozen. Room was lovely but after midnight we were up half the night from people screaming in the streets and sanitation picking garbage up from the many restaurants. I liked the hotel but they need to change the windows.Breakfast very continental.Voffee, bagel, muffins and fruit.

A great little hotel situated in mid Manhattan. We were within easy walking distance of Madison Square Park, Union Square, Empire State Building. A little further and you were at Madison Square Garden and other key locations. Very close to 23rd St subway station.Continental breakfast was rubbish whilst we were there. On 2 days there was nothing available at all. We intentionally didn’t book full breakfasts as we wanted to go out and eat, a good job really. (Only reason for 4 stars rather than 5)Rooms were good, clean, beds comfortable and the shower was good too. Don’t open the sweets and cookies or valentines sex kit you’ll be charged for this. (Yes I did say sex kit but it’s not as it sounds, it’s a tin with a few items and is discrete enough) The water, Tea and Coffee is complimentary and replenished each day.The room cleaning service is to a good standard.2 lifts operate in the hotel.WiFi is fast and free.The reception/staff are friends and helpful. We were helped with cases after our checkout as well as having a taxi booked for us to JFK.

For my last vacation, I have to say the best place I stayed was Hotel Henri. Besides being in NYC(the greatest city in the world) this hotel was awesome! It was FREEZING when I arrived and I was greeted by Mike with a hot chocolate and cider which was a fantastic touch. Andie was able to check me into my room early and offered information about restaurants and things to do in the area. All the staff was super friendly and accomodating. 100% recommend this hotel to all!

I had a long, 9 night stay in NY for February fashion week. Originally, I had planned to only stay 8 nights but had to come in a day early at the very last minute. They were very flexible and able to open my room up for an extra night on short notice.The staff here were very accommodating to make sure I was comfortable at all times, even making it a point to call up to my room and check on me from time-to-time. The room was a lot more spacious than I was anticipating, and I'd say was a perfect size for one or two people (I had a one bedroom king size standard room). Very clean. Also, the location is perfect with various subway stations within a one block radius. Honestly, for the price, location, and overall comfortability - you really can't beat it. The free pass to the Equinox gym down the street was also great! And complimentary bottled water throughout my whole stay was another great touch. Oh and of course the in-room Keurig for a coffee (or tea) drinker is the best.The staff at the bar upstairs were also very friendly, and drinks were delicious! Thanks Hotel Henri staff :-).

This gem is in my top 3 favorite hotels in Manhattan. Let’s start with a free breakfast, copy of The Wall Street Journal and Icelandic water bottles every day. The location is fantastic - surrounded by Zagat rated restaurants, 2 min walk from Eataly Flatiron, shopping centers, bars, Trader Joe’s, and the 23 Street station. The staff were very attentive and kind. James and Odell at the front desk welcomed us and even changed our reservation so that our stay would be more comfortable. The hotel itself is immaculate and modern. The rooms are very clean and there are always staff checking the common areas. We stayed for two weeks even though we only planned on staying for one! We will definitely stay here if we want to explore NYC again.

review_body: My stay was great -- perfect location to everything. The only thing that wasn't up to par was the the water pressure of the shower. Other than that, the room, staff and bartenders (Juan was awesome and made our time in the roof bar so fun) really impressed.

I was being charged $37 for some kind of snacks in the hotel room which I never had, I never have snacks provided by the hotel room since i know is very expensive. I called Hotel Henri and they said they checked their inventory every single day and accused me had the snacks and charged me without my permission. I was thinking may be their workers or thieves entered my room when I checked out. I was totally disappointed the way the hotel manage this issue. My partner and I stayed here most of the night when we visit Manhattan, and this time truly disappoint us!

Spent a long weekend at Hotel Henri with friends. The rooms are clean and have a modern upscale feel. There were not large rooms by any measure but they have made use of every square inch of space. Friendly staff all around and helpful. Great Keurig coffee maker in your room (bring your own pods if you have favorite coffee). Location is wonderful for setting around. Subway stops are located on both ends of the block (2 different lines) and you can get an inexpensive cab ride to the Broadway theatres.Only complaint we had was their “facilities fee” of $25 a day tacked on the bill at check out. Our reservation from the hotel quoted a price for the room but they tacked on an additional $25 a night! We ran into “facility fees” in Miami a few years back. Seems that there are some markets where this is becoming common practice. If you don’t read your bill they might just slip it by you. We complained (bitterly) and they removed it.

Very well located hotel with small but modern, functional and quiet rooms--not necessarily a lot of light in the rooms depending on their location. The hotel provides access to a nearby, outstanding gym. The location of the hotel provides access to transportation that easily gets you to most parts of Manhattan. If you are the type of traveler that does not spend a lot of time in the hotel, this is a very satisfying option.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My daughter and I was in the city for a long weekend. I became ill and couldn’t get comfortable in our bed. Staff James, and Ronnie were so accommodating to finding us just the right fit. The location is a great place. Overall highly recommend!

Hello. This was my first time visiting New York City and I was so excited to do so as it was my birthday Month. I had a really difficult time choosing a hotel as there were so many but decided on staying somewhere in the middle which was the gramercy area near the famous masidson square park. Luckily there were a few hotels in the area and Hotel Henri seemed cool, swanky, and well price. I booked the balcony room as I wanted a nice view. Boy, I was surprised as the balcony room was the biggest they had and on the top floor! I asked the front desk also if I could see the other rooms, they were smaller, so I was happy on my choice. The hotel give me free coffee maker inside the room and free bottled water. I was a very happy camper. The staff is very friend and some are very good looking. Overall I enjoyed my visit in NYC. Thank you Hotel Henri personnel!

I just had an amazing weekend in NYC at the Sir Henri. Ronni was my first contact upon trying to check in. I'd arrived early and wanted to drop my bag to begin the fun. Ronni was a wealth of information on nearby attractions and places to eat. Additionally, she coordinates tours if desired and is a valuable asset to the Sir Henri team. The room (12th floor) was quiet, nicely appointed and very comfortable. It also contained a safe, a few essential toiletries and umbrella if one needed them. My room would have been comfortable for two, but an older child would have begun to make it a bit crowded. I encountered other very friendly and helpful staff members during my stay. I found the continental breakfast offering rather substantial featuring various pastries, some fruit, juice, coffee and tea. Lena was here and was friendly and helpful. It is worth obtaining the breakfast coupon. I agree with other reviewers in that the location is great for walking and exploring or summoning a ride. I did not drive but did see a garage nearby.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Terrific location and relatively inexpensive Lee priced but my floor was loud with work being done on the building and the cleaning staff very early in the morning on the weekend. Their continental breakfast was beyond sub par. If the hotel was in a better repair then my rating would’ve been much higher

This property is centrally located. A short walk to Times Square and easy access to Subway. Clean, modern and friendly, helpful staff. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Onsite restaurant was great. Concierge was able to assist with all our requests. I would highly recommend this property.

By far the kindest, friendliest staff I’ve had the pleasure of coming in contact with on my travels. I had a terrible experience the day my flight landed, but the moment I arrived and checked into Hotel Henri it was like a breath of fresh air. They were amazing welcoming, offered me complimentary drinks at the rooftop bar and made sure my every need was catered to. They went out of their way to lift my spirits and I’ll always remember that!The room itself was superb... reminded me of Dash in Bali. All round excellent stay at hotel Henri! I’ll be sure to return

I had such a great stay at Hotel Henri. Right in the middle of everything and in walking distance of some great museums and restaurants. We had a wonderful time and the service was spectacular. I can't wait to go back and stay longer and spend sometime on the roof top bar.

It was clean and quaint. I did get to see Emril Lagasse in the lobby. I wished the room service stayed open later as I had just gotten into town and had to walk to find food open since the kitchen was closed. The heat was challenging in the room but the staff was friendly and the room was cute.

Very friendly staff and the place was nice. Great location for getting around and exploring. Nice rooftop bar and everything worked well inside. Very hot showers which was nice and we all enjoyed our experience

Biggest pro: location. Biggest cons: noise, customer service and cleanliness.Complaining to reception or maintenance did not achieve the result of getting a clean, functioning room. I'd hesitate to recommend this hotel.

One of those rooms that has lights and lamps everywhere, but you still don't have light where you need it. Only half the closet was usable because the hangers were too big, so you couldn't slide the closet doors.Couldn't turn off heat in the room the first night and had to unscrew light bulb since there was no way to turn off light over mini bar. Luckily these were both addressed the Next day, but frustrating when you get in late, want to iron some clothes and get some sleep. I could see coming back, but mainly because of the location in relation to the offices I visit in the area.

This hotel came highly recommended by a business colleague as it within walking distance of the office. Boy, was I disappointed. The location was great. The amenities were good. But that was about it.The window in the room would not close shut and it's so noisy and cold in Jan that it kept me up all night. They promised to fix it but did not repeatedly. The bathroom shower door would not close shut and it flooded the bathroom floor. The chair was ratty and had holes in it. All in all, extremely surprising that it was such a poor experience and that complaining to the Hotel did not actually get them to fix it. Extremely poor maintenance. I'd find it hard to recommend this hotel to anyone.

This spot has a narrow entranceway next to a restaurant whose signage kind of dominates. Inside is a small lobby with friendly staff. We stayed on the 11th floor...only 6 rooms per floor. Appreciated the red translucent shade that let in some light but gave privacy.

What a nice find. Great location in an area of the the city we typically don’t see. Took advantage of Eataly which was just a block away.Staff is very friendly and helpful. The Hot Cocoa station in the lobby was especially “sweet”. Rooms were very nice particularly the lighting and shower. And, finally, the pastries at breakfast were delicious.

I got a room below the rooftop bar and the noise was terrible till midnight. Front desk staff did nothing to help. Then a 6:00 AM the alarm clock of the room next door woke me up because the walls are paper thin. Very bad stay

If ever in Manhattan, the place to stay is Hotel Henri! The staff is professional but accommodating and the service is impeccable. They are friendly (which can be difficult to find in a large, busy city) and very helpful. Their rooms are modern and roomy for the area of Manhattan. You can't beat the location..walking distance to the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, restaurants, shopping and many more attractions. A short ride will take you to Central Park, the Met and more places of interest. And the hotel is home to Rodo's, an Emeril Lagasse restaurant which you shouldn't miss. You may see he wandering around and speaking with customers. We did! He is so friendly and will gladly sign an autograph or take a picture with you. Besides, the food is outstanding. We will definitely come back here on our next visit to New York.

My sister and I stayed at the Henri during a short visit to NYC. The location is perfect for visiting the city. We walked to Times Square to see plays in the evening. During the day we walked from the hotel to the High Line and down to the 9/11 Museum. Greenwich Village and NYU are a short walk away as well. In addition to the location the room was very comfortable and the bed was great so we had two good night's sleep. The only disappointment was the breakfast buffet. The offerings were mostly sugary sweets with no protein options, The second morning we went out for breakfast. Other than that we were very happy and appreciated the friendly and helpful staff.

Great value and good location. Close to subways and on same block as Eatily. Chef Emeril in the house at Mediterranean Rodos! Gym access off site. Comp continental breakfast weak, Starbucks close by. Front desk friendly and accommodating.

Very nice hotel in NYC. The staff was friendly and very attentive. The rooms are on the small side but I didnt go to NYC to stay in the room. Everything was very clean and exactly how it is in the pictures. The restaurant in this hotel is exceptional. The rooftop bar was nice and once again very friendly staff. I will definately keep this on my go to list for NYC!

Very nice hotel and in a great location within NYC. Staff was very helpful. The new restaurant was also very good. Wish they had a few more breakfast options. All in all, a great stay and would recommend it to business and holiday travelers.

check in was fast,Ronnie was great!! she was was knowledgeable and welcoming.room was a bit small but cozy, location was perfect.we did not get to visit the restaurant only because it closed by 10pm on Sunday however, we do look forward to visiting again real soon. our experience was great, and for the price we couldn't ask for more.

Overall my stay in hotel Henri was good, the only part is did not like was the fact that they did not have a microwave and fridge was not so cooling. So I could not preserve my food and this led to wastage for me.

I stayed here for my first time few days ago and i absolutely loved everything about it. I would stay here again and plan too. I love Wyndham but this one was one of the best. The room decor and style is so nyc, the bathrooms are nice and spacious, hot strong shower, cute bathroom dressing room style bulbs... rooftop bar and such nice accommodating staff. Recommended!

Great location for the price. Rooms were a little small but for a solo business traveler it does the job just fine. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and I loved the free hot cider and cocoa bar (with Fireball whiskey and rum as add-ons!) in the lobby to warm up from the winter cold. The hallways got a little noisy at night and it seemed as if folks were right outside the door if anyone talked out there but nothing crazy.My only big disappointment was my experience in the rooftop bar and lounge. The bartender was very cold and seemed annoyed to serve my friend and I. It was a quiet Tuesday night with only a few others at the bar and it took us probably 15 minutes from drink order to drink delivered. I'll also note their food room service is a bit odd in that it's through a restaurant rather then the hotel and it's not 24/7, I wish I had been told that upon check in but not a huge deal with all the food delivery apps out there.

Excellent! We loved the Henri Hotel. Food was delicious. Staff helpful and pleasant. As a Wyndham member, we were pleasantly surprised by receiving two complimentary drinks at the rooftop bar. What a treat!

We stayed overnight at Hotel Henri. Location is terrific if you are planning on being in Midtown or South. Staff is outstanding. Ronni at check in and Carlos, the bellman provided terrific customer service. This hotel offered a # of extras. Free bottled water, hot chocolate with marshmallows in lobby and wifi. Being a Wyndham member a continental breakfast was included for the three of us. It was my daughter and her friend's birthdays, Ronni gave us free drink vouchers at the rooftop bar. I wish the rooms were a bit larger, but that is usually an issue in NYC and the price was great! I would definitely stay again

Our stay was pretty good. We were staying in the city over the week and used our Wyndham points. Surprised location was Nice and convenient. Also, the Keurig was a big plus in my book. My husband and I totally adored this hotel. Thank you for the stay Henri Hotel Team!

It wasn't my first time in NYC, but to stay in such a great hotel – that's a first.Location? Amazing! Staff? Wonderful (special shout out to Melisa at reception who was just incredible)! Rooms? Large (compared to usual New York room sizes). Price? At first I thought it's a mistake. But be smart – book really really early. Honestly this is a first hotel in New York I would love to come back.

We travel a lot. We have earned max status with several chains to try them out. Wyndham usually results in disappointment, unfortunately. We have only truly enjoyed a handful of locations. The best ones being Hawaii, and now Hotel Henri.If it isn't poor staff and dingy looking places, it's not advertising the location properly (looking at you Ravel with your boom boom rooftop bass making it nigh impossible for a good nights sleep), to flies on the food, to no food at all, Wyndham has often been a big letdown.When I checked in I mentioned to the front desk we were on the 14 day challenge to match max status with Wyndham, we usually have had bad experiences and were really hoping things would not be that way here. He apologized for our poor prior experiences at other hotels but said he would do his best to make sure things were good here. He then spent a few minutes talking about the new restaurant and a michilin star restaurant nearby when I asked for food recommendations. I am happy to say that our experience at Hotel Henri was the compete opposite. When we got to the room we received a small upgrade due to being max status. In our room was a bottle of champagne. The room was clean and well maintained. It also had all the little extras you might need like tooth paste, a sewing kit, makeup removers etc. The only negative about the room was you could hear peoples doors and talking when they were in the hallway.In the evening they had fireball whiskey, rum, cider, and hot chocolate for guests for no additional cost. Seeing as how it was cold this was a really nice touch and something I saw several guests partaking in. The restaurant was a bit on the pricey side, even for new york, but it was all delicious and tasty. The service at the restaurant was fast and attentive. We did not have to ask for anything at any time. The bellpersons I would also like to throw a shoutout too as they brought in and out over 30 bags for us as we had done a lot of shopping. Pro tip: You can find free parking on the weekend by going where TWo Brothers Pizza is and parking on that area. Most of the parking restrictions are removed for Saturday and Sundays. Just read the signs carefully. We ended up saving about 50 bucks for parking this way. Otherwise use Spothero to save a bit of cash.

Hotel was new and chiq, with comfortable living space and a very nice urban twist on decor. Price was reasonable and it was situated in the heart of manhattan. I will definitely go again as I am always receiving deals via email.

This hotel is in a great location with lots of places within walking distance and you can catch the subway nearby. The area around the hotel is safe as well. Rooms are small but that is normal for Nee York. Staff was friendly and helpful when asking questions about getting around.

The reason we chose this hotel was the good price. Love the nice location and view. Good hotel facilities. The rest area is also nice people can take a rest and gather there. We would stay at this hotel again.

This boutique hotel is convenient to Penn Station,Chelsea and Greenwich Village, all within walking distance. Rooms are small but clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Do not accept a room on 17th floor unless you enjoy hearing thumping percussion until midnight. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

From the time that I walked into this boutique hidden gem, until I hailed my taxi to head back to Penn Station; I felt welcomed. The room, bar, and personal concierge were all great. This is not your grandmother’s extended stay. You feel the sense of practical elegance from the creative furnishings and attention to detail. All of the hosts were great every during each interaction with them. I definitely recommend the laidback hideaway rooftop bar.

I stayed here before and it seemed pretty good. This time there was a lot of miscommunication. I stayed after traveling for a funeral so my funds were tied up I was told there would not be an additional hold or security but due to the low balance cause of the unexpected expenses I ended up having to use another card so basically ended up paying for 2 rooms. The restaurant was closed, The manager offered to make up for the stay by notating my membership account and said they would follow up but she did not as of yet almost 2 weeks later.

I was disappointed with how small the room was and the rooftop lounge was not as great as advertised. The customer service was also not up to par. The room decor seemed cheap and was not worth the money.

Nassau, New Providence Island

review_body: Enjoyed our stay but wished the restaurant was open. The rooftop bar was nice for a break. The staff was very hospitable and welcoming. It was convenient for our sightseeing and transportation was nearby. Would stay there again.

With no parking, it’s costing us $75 /day for a pickup.The staff is nice and the drinks are good, but the facility was poor. Improper directions to rooms, sloppy painting, mold in shower grout, and smell of weed coming from the stairwell just to name a few issues. Emeril Lagasse was consulting at the newly opened restaurant - Rojas. I was a shocked when Emeril asked how we like the food then left. (We were the only patrons in the restaurant) My spouse ordered the whole artichoke which tasted like tuna fish. I ordered the Louisiana Crawfish pasta which tasted like old seafood. We wont be returning or do we recommend.We have stayed in numerous Wyndham establishments from timeshares to hotels and this was the worst. The staff was nice....

Stayed with family on a vacations for the holidays. Staff was excellent and couldn't be more helpful. Location was good, in the middle of Manhattan, easy access to ride sharing. No onsite hotel parking, but a parking garage was just 2 doors down.

All of the staff from the front desk to the housekeepers are extremely friendly and accommodating. The location is great lots of bars, clubs and restaurants near by. I am very satisfied with my stay and will be returning. This was a 10/10 for me.

My Wyndham stay at hotel Henry was great, the accommodation were perfect, the rooms were clean and comfortable the house was minimal and the staff was kind and friendly, it was close to many popular sites in NYC

Room was just what we needed. Clean, very comfortable bed and nice shower. The service staff couldn't have been nicer. A free cocktail at the rooftop bar upon arrival. Free breakfast each morning. Complimentary unlimited water bottle service the whole stay. The location was perfect in my opinion. Right next to Madison Square Park with great fast food and coffee spots like Eataly and Shake Shack. Close to Union Square and Grammercy Park. Quick trip to Upper West, and both sides of Downtown. I will only stay here in the future.

Great stay, rooms are small but the beds are huge and very comfortable. Would recommend & stay here again! We paid for a balcony room the only issue being it’s close to the rooftop bar which can be noisy... location great for Subway, bars, cafes & restaurants!

This hotel may only be for the 30 under crowd looking for a great location in flat iron part of NYC but for the price it is not a great deal. Rooms were small and uncomfortable (literally bed bowed in the middle, lights falling off walls, yellow dim light in bathroom). We were two floors below the rooftop bar and still could not sleep till after two (bar is best part if you want to party but I was there on work so terrible). Hot chocolate is about best part of it. Truly will not stay here again.

Stayed with a friend in a double room facing backwards. Which end up being good cause there was no noise at all. Another friends who got a front room, complaint a lot about the street noises.The room was small but clean. The bed really soft but I had no problems with it. The shower had a leak and the bathroom got SOAKED everytime one took a shower. Despite my complaints, nothing was dome about it.The real downfall of the hotel was the service. This hotel doesn’t have a formal front desk. There’s a tiny table with one or two people tops. And no one willing to help. Location was ok. Would not stay again.

I chose to celebrate my 51st birthday in NYC. I couldn't have selected a better hotel to stay. From check-in to check -out the staff was incredible. Diana and Carlos were so friendly when I check in. I was in and out sight seeing and Diana spoke to me every time. When I ask about a restaurant I wanted to go to the gentleman in the lobby escorted me to the location, which was nearby. The hotel was clean, well maintained, and nicely decorated. Overall my stay was great and it was the staff that won me over from the start.

We stayed for a week and got metro cards and could easily get anywhere on the subway. We visited Central Park, Harlem, soho China town and Little Italy. The restaurant was closed at the hotel for renovations but there was restaurants everywhere. Nice park in a short walking distance. I would definitely come back here.15 minutes to Central Park 8 minutes from soho or Times Square.

A last minute business trip before year end my partner arranged a reservation for me in Manhattan. Hotel Henri is a boutique hotel that's part of the Wyndham chain. The front end staff is amazing and helpful. Parking is pricey but not an issue with hotel but just NYC parking. Still, that too is worth every penny and secure. Back to hotel, their downstairs restaurant is being renovated but the rooftop restaurant is small but cozy and intimate. See my review of Sir Henri Rooftop.The lobby here is small compared to most hotels, with two elevators. There are 12 floors + rooftop restaurant.Rooms are more typical of European, small, yet contemporary style and appointment. The bathroom is roomy, great water pressure and well lit. We had a Deluxe King room, comes with safe, iron and board, free WiFi, desk and mini bar. Large screen TV, good selection of channels. And Clean !! Centrally located between Times Square and Wall Street, just off 6th Ave. Easy walking distance to the shopping, restaurants. Tucked away on West 24th Street. A great hotel to just escape. To the staff... well done.
