review_body: I have had two great 3-night stays in June 2018 and plan two more in both July and August. I travel on consulting assignments and work in the financial district, but this hotel and location work very well for me. Great room, excellent service, responsive staff, and quiet time for sleeping! Great combination!

We were a group of 4 (3 adults and 1 child) who stayed at the Hotel Henri in New York City for 9 days (June 15 through 23, 2018).Though the rooms were somewhat small, they were comfortable and the location of the hotel was excellent: in a nice neighborhood with easy access to uptown sites as well as good shopping, restaurants nearby.What really made our stay so pleasant though, was the staff at the front desk (indeed, all the staff working reception were most helpful).From the start we had an issue with our reservation because of a missed flight and our travel agency. James worked to correct the issue and soon had us checked in to our rooms.All the staff I came in contact with was pleasant but I must say that the staff working in reception was exceptional! They provided excellent customer service.Throughout our stay, I asked countless questions of the hotel reception staff and they consistently provided the information with a smile and pleasant demeanor. They even sometimes went above and beyond to help (like when Jose went out of his way to go home in order to check out an ice cream truck for us!)Kudos to James, Jose, Denny, Chuck, Carlos and Stephan for their unfailing patience, kind attention and warm, approachable attitudes.Would definitely stay at Hotel Henri again!

1) The staff & service at Hotel Henri is excellent.2) Your telephone customer service rates a 1 on a scale of 1-10. I travel frequently for work (both internation & domestic). Wyndham's phone CS is abysmal & a consistently wastes my time.3) If the Hotel Henri's staff was not excellent, I would use my corporate Marriott account.Thank you,Janet M Harouse917 509 5043

Let me just say, the service was impressive and not at all what I was expecting even in a boutique hotel.  Denny at the main desk was genuinely kind and helpful, all about service.  The hotel itself felt small but I was happy with the room size even after reading some reviews.  I did hear little noise in the hallway but it was a Friday night.  Over all I really enjoyed my stay and look forward to coming back.

Location and the bed were great - very comfy and good night's sleep.Service was not amazing, had to ask 3 times in 36 hours to get a broken coffee machine fixed which was not ideal. The breakfast was poor for a 4 star hotel, with limited buffet offering options of just pastries and cereal and no healthy options. The staff there even seemed a bit embarrassed about it.Rooms are strange design - trying to be artsy, but come across a bit tacky with strange wallpaper. Lighting was nice though. Overall, an ok hotel but there's better 4 star options in New York.

Excellent location - close to the subway and great restaurants. The service was fabulous at their rooftop bar (the staff could not be more accommodating). The complimentary breakfast was a little bit skimpy, but I may be used to European style at this point. The front desk and concierge staff were delightful. Our rooms were well appointed. This boutique hotel is well worth the look and a bargain when compared to the W, where I usually stay.

Great stay with the girls! Staff was more then helpful and friendly, never felt like a bother with my many questions. Breakfast was a nice touch especially since it's served till 11am. Parking was also very convenient. We recieved a discounted rate at a local garage a few doors down from the hotel. Already looking forward to my next visit.

I like the location. The hotel Greek restaurant was delicious. The bed caved in. The shower leaked water. The walls are paper thin and you can hear when a neighbor opens and closes their door. If the neighbor is loud you hear everything all hours of the night because the hallways are so small. Rooms are very small.

ALL of the staff and especially Chuck, Denni, and Carlos were friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, and very calm under pressure. I had a special weekend planned for my wife and Chuck helped me make it happen even better than I planned by helped my me purchase some surprise gifts. Mike made sure that our items during check in and check out were cared for. Our room was nicely decorated and perfect size, I also really appreciate the fact that the bathroom has a ventilation fan to keep moisture out of the bathroom helping to keep it really clean. We are really looking forward to staying at Hotel Henri again as soon as possible!

I stayed at Hotel Henri for one night this past weekend and must say it's the first time I remember being surprised by a hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. While the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was quite small with everything seemingly in miniature. The bathroom was half of normal size with a single sink and small counter; the shower was very small and would not accommodate a large person. The desk was half of a normal size. There was a small space between the front of the bed and the wall to walk to the other side. The floor of the room was a cold tile rather than carpet, which likely has benefits in terms of cleaning. The innovative and creative lighting and decor felt very trendy and cool and I was impressed by how much they fit in such a small area. I was fine by myself but if my husband was with me, we would have been maneuvering around each other to get to the bathroom, bed, etc. I met a couple there who had also relied on Trip Advisor reviews and had the same impression. We wondered if we had each just had the bad luck of getting a postage stamp sized room but concluded that every floor and every room was the same size based on the structure of the hotel. Small rooms seem to be the trend and are fine if that's what you expect. A continental breakfast is served in the Rooftop lounge and is free if you book directly through Wyndham. I enjoyed coffee and the view although the cereals and baked goods are not what I enjoy for breakfast.Rereading this review, it sounds very negative, which was not my intention. Just want to alert people to the compact nature and small size of the rooms so they are not surprised at check in as I was.

We had a room on the 15fh floor that was quiet and relaxing. Loved the rooftop lounge for a drink or two before heading out on the town!! Very comfortable and not far from transportation to Midtown and othe points around Manhattan. We will stay here again!

The staff was friendly and helpful in every way imaginable. They had great recommendations for restaurants, tours and always greeted us no matter where we were in the hotel. Jose, Dillon and James always had a great smile for us in the lobby with helpful info and directions. Fernando was a super friendly face around the hotel and very informative of the area. This hotel was the right size for a couple or small family. The rooms were nice and neat. The street wasn’t busy and centrally locates to all sites.

Scored a great rate for a weekend escape for wife's birthday at Hotel Henri. Awesome location, walking distance to lots of great restaurants and sight seeing. Staff was super friendly, special shout out to the evening weekend team for the great recommendations! will be back!

2nd stay here, which says a fair bit. Friendly staff, Good AC and a good shower. Rooms a bit on the small side, but this is Manhattan so no biggie.Here's the thing though. The WiFi is complimentary, as are the water bottles in the room. And I didn't need to sign up to their loyalty programme to get this. Chicago Hilton, take note. COMPLIMENTARY. As in 'thanks for staying, have something on us'. There's a great Greek restaurant next door too. Do your stomach a favour: Go there.

I visited New York for a conference and this hotel was perfect for business travelers. It was quiet, on a side street yet centrally located to stores, restaurants, pharmacies, all within walking distance. The rooftop breakfast that was included was a great place to start the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back for business or a pleasure trip to New York. It's an easy stroll to Penn Station also.

Absolutely loved our stay here. Outstanding service, top quality rooms, and perfect location. Definitely would stay here again. Our friends loved the available amenities and everyone was well rested after sight seeing in the city. Highly reccomend

This is an amazing hotel! The check in was quick and they even let us check in earlier because our room was ready. the breakfast was a great added bonus. To be able to sit in the penthouse and enjoy my coffee while standing on the balcony was a great start to our day before exploring the city all day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City.

It was my first time staying here and i loved it. The staff is truly amazing and the drinks upstairs on the roof are top notch. I loved how your room is very dark and it feels like you can sleep all day. I needed this time to refuel and reconnect with my husband Hotel Henri was our home away from home this past weekend. I wish surely reccomend it to my friends and family.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I had a very nice stay at this hotel. I was afraid that the rooms would be too small but they were perfect for myself and my husband. The front desk were especially warm and friendly and never too busy to assist with any questions you had. The bar was very nice but a bit too noisy to have an actual conversation. The breakfast was included and a nice way to get your day started. We will return again.

I had an enjoyable stay at this unique Wyndham property. I usually stay at Wyndham Gardens but this place was very different. Small rooms but well designed with a boutique feel. Service stood out the most as the staff couldn't be more helpful with my questions and request. The rooftop bar Henri was a nice touch as was the Greek restaurant. I would definitely recommend it and the price was terrific.

Have stayed in NYC numerous times - this was my first stay in Hotel Henri....but definitely not my last!!! Hotel is lovely and more than meets all requirements. Staff extremely friendly & helpful. The location is excellent. Definitely worth a stay.

Very friendly and service-oriented staff. Rooms were surprisingly large for NYC. Great location with easy walk to Flatiron, Union Square. Plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhood. The rooftop bar was kinda neat but could have used a few more lights. It doubles as the breakfast bar in the morning. Pretty decent continental offering.

Loved the room it was stylish and modern and most important very clean. The staff was very friendly, professional and super helpful. Breakfast exceeded my expectations. Will definetly be back and already recommended it to friends.

I recently stayed at the Hotel Henri and let me just say everything was amazing ! Excellent customer service, clean stylish rooms and great location. I appreciated all he help I received from the front desk staff Stephanie and a Chuck. They assured with any request I had from dinner plans to car service back to the airport. Will definitely stay here again and recommend this property.! Thanks again guys !

I have to say this may be one of my favorite hotels in NYC! Perfect location, The staff was wonderful and always so helpful. Room was cozy and had everything I needed. The in room Keurig is a great touch for a coffee drinker such as myself. Will be back :-)

We traveled for a family wedding and had a great stay at the Hotel Henri. The hotel is excellent and we will return as soon as possible. Rooms were excellent and location is brilliant. Have to mention how nice and extraudinarily helpful all the staff were / are.We will certainly be back

Hotel was very clean, staff were all pleasant and helpful. Rooms were very well kept and clean. The rooms felt very homey, more like your own personal studio apartment. The serve a continental breakfast which was more than enough for breakfast. There is a rooftop bar and small patio there as well. Times Square and Madison Square Gardens just a few minutes away, you can walk or a cab would get you there for less than $8. Overall I give this hotel very high reviews, I would definitely stay there again.

Wonderful elegant hotel. The rooms were great and the bathrooms were outstanding and very much updated. The hotel itself is in a great location for where I needed to be so the walk was short and very senic.

The locations is fantastic. The service is great the staff are very helpful and respectful , they exceeded my expectations and treated me great. The front desk staff, and others were very accommodating. The room was quiet and the bed amazing.Thank you to all for making my recent visit memorable.

Hotel is small but nice. Rooms are very modern, bathrooms are updated.The only thing I would suggest is more lighting inside the rooms. Better to have more light then not enough.I would recommend this hotel. It’s in a good location.I recommended it to a colleague

A day trip into Manhattan for a business meeting turned into a last minute overnight stay. From the intial call to make a reservation, to the check in with Frankie to the overall experience -simple yet clean and thoughful guestrooms, super helpful staff and awesome location, Hotel Henri cannot be beat! Will return with the girlfriend's birthday next month!

This hotel has really great staff, from the housekeeping ladies to the front desk people. I was able to check in to my room early and go on about my day. I had breakfast in the bar area but I hoped they included some hot items to get you started. My room was small but very well designed and it was perfect for me since i was traveling alone. I didn't get a chance to try the restaurant but I promise that when I return I will definitely have dinner there. The only negative thing about this hotel is the small lobby but other than that it is so perfect.

Great spot. Clean, well furnished and well equipped rooms. Helpful and attentive staff. I forgot my comb - someone on staff went out and bought one for me and left it in my room. Great value compared to some of the other hotels I've stayed in in Midtown. The one thing that lets it down is the breakfast. I'll definitely recommend it to my colleagues.

I'm not usually one to post reviews but I had a really great business trip at Henry that I just had to follow through. I stayed almost a week ago and although the hotel was clearly busy with people coming and going, the reception desk team was super helpful and eager to assist. I was even impressed with the cleaning crew who were just as polite, Rooms were small but well designed, it actually has a nice boutique feel. My first time at this hotel but not likely to be my last.

Hotel is relatively small with few rooms per floor. Convenient to everything in Chelsea. Hotel is kept clean and bed is comfortable. Staff are all helpful. Walls are relatively thin- can hear when your neighbor is showering or coming in/out of room.

We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel.Frank was courteous, helpful and gracious. We were allowed to park our car in front of the hotel for an hour, so we could get ready for an evening event. The room was small, no view, but had a contemporary, spirited decor. I especially liked the laminated floor, which is much more hygienic than a carpet. The shower was excellent and the bed very comfortable. The sink in the bathroom was a bit too small, but there was a nice shelf tor toiletries.All staff members were friendly including the porter, the lady at the breakfast room and the checkout person Chick.The breakfast was simple, but of quality. Parking at the garage 40 meters away was convenient and inexpensive by New York standards, USD 40 for 24 hours, since the facility had a contract with the hotel.

James was there our entire stay. Seriously dedicated and made our stay awesome. Helped us with everything. Room was cool, james was cooler. If there was something I would remember it wouldn’t be the wallpaper wood it will be james. Give that man a raise.

I have stayed at the property a couple of times the last two months and I find it to be somewhat conveniently located but there are some problems with the property. First is the room itself be in very dark from natural sunlight and not adequately having incandescent bulbs. Second well being small the use of spaces well-done but the quality of the bed it is marginal and the bathroom shower leaks onto the floor.With a little bit of work this hotel could shine.

This retrofit office/come hotel has small rooms, lumpy pillows, noisy a/c, loud and inconsiderate night time maintenance and disorganised staff. 2 of 3 nights staff was banging away restocking cupboards between 2-3am about 2 feet outside my bedroom door; even using his phone. One day room was never made up, wet towels left on floor. Couldn't use roof bar for meeting one day due to private event yet told ground floor bar would open for another hour. Room also felt like a dark bunker.. with super noisy a/c unit.

I stayed at Hotel Henri during a short business trip, and it exceeded all of my expectations. The hotel is located near the intersection of 6th Ave. and 24th St., a short walk away from many restaurants and amenities. My room was spotless and had a trendy minimalist design. Nearby street traffic was minimal, making for a peaceful sleep. The onsite penthouse cocktail lounge and Greek restaurant next door were added bonuses. The employees at reception were also highly responsive and helped book a cab for the return trip to the airport.Overall, I was impressed with the quality of accommodations and services offered. Would definitely recommend.

Pros: Great location. Modern design. Mini-bar equipped. Cons: The room is very very dark even if I turned on the every single light in the room.The door and window is very thin and it is very very VERY NOISY during the entire stay.Besides that, we were given 4th floor facing street even we asked for quite rooms and booked through Official website. Again, it is unacceptably noisy, and also no view.The rooftop is OK. The breakfast may or may not be complimentary given the booking status. I didn't try despite qualified. The gym is very far and it requires to get a paper from the hotel before heading there, which creates some inconvenience. The mini-bar is fully equipped, which is not very common recently. It can be good, but given the limited space, I won't suggest to have so many items inside and outside. Moreover, we tried to request a firm pillow but they took more than 30 minutes and two calls to send up 2 pillows which were very plush. On the second morning, the request for extra conditioners took even longer. The service could really be better.

review_body: They were supposed to charge my card $100 for incidentals but charged it over $600! The manager Maria refused to fix it and called security out because I refuted the charge. VERY unprofessional. Extremely inciting of a paying guest who had every right to be upset. Would not ever stay here again and would NEVER recommend it to anyone. Bait and switch "hotel" with no true amenities.

Good location, great Service, the room size was ok. One nigth we have some noise from the terrace, the bed was incredible and the check inn and out Service was so fast. I really recommend this hotel for a 3 to 4 days trip.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Room very quiet, bed and pillows great for sleeping. Nice continental breakfast buffet with all you could want - even fresh croissants, fruit and expresso! Roof top lounge has happy hour specials. Heat hit NYC the day I arrived, but the AC revved up quickly and the room was very comfy. Staff super friendly and helpful. Very clean and perfectly appointed. Small rooms (normal in NYC), but nice - and a king sized bed! Nothing lacking!

review_body: My husband often stays in the hotel for business and I came out to join him for a weekend.The hotel was in a great location mainly because it was quiet but we could also walk everywhere. Our room was nice, it is a boutique style hotel and the room represents this. It was also quiet in the room and we slept really well.There are not really any amenities at this hotel. The roof top bar is lovely we went up there for a drink.I would stay here again and do would my husband.

Near Madison Square Park in Flat Iron neighborhood across from Eataly shopping mart. Walked down Broadway to Penn Station on a nice day in fifteen minutes or less. Near subway stops. Nice but pricey roof top bar with view of Freedom Tower.

I was there for 3 nights; HVAC did not work properly and the property solution was to turn it off and open the window facing a interior shaft filled with noisy mechanical equipment. Complained the second day and nothing happened. Bar was extremely expensive and staff seemed to be having more fun blaring music than the guest. Only one elevator was working.Drinks were mediocre and beer was warm.Overcharged for my stay, which after some time the property corrected. Only to find out I was DOUBLE CHARGED for my stay on top of the wrongful charge. After a month of phone calls I was finally told I was right but they couldn't fix the wrongful charge and that I needed to dispute it thru my credit card. Too many choices to put up with all the hassles. Stay at your own risk.

Loved the customer service from the staff, continental breakfast, free WiFi, and within walking distance to many places. Hotel needs to provide wash clothes, instead of hand towels, but mainly is a less squeaky bed for a comfortable night sleep. One thing I loved about the accessories in the room is the 'tin can' for lovers -- 1st time I had seen one in a room in a major city.

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary in the city and decided to treat ourselves to a overnight stay without the kids. I initially heard about Hotel Henri from a girlfriend who stayed there for business some time ago and raved about the location and service. All I have to say is WOW! Super friendly and professional staff- every single person we encountered from the bell staff to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, every employee took the time to say hello and ask us how we were enjoying our stay. We encountered a gentleman in the elevator who I believe was a manger, I'm so sorry I forgot his name, but he over heard us talking to our kids on the phone and would you believe he left us a bag of donuts with a note saying to "enjoying our time away together"! We felt like royalty! Now mind you, we don't typically get away much these days but its these details that really make a difference. The hotel is located near tons of great places to eat, close walking distance to shopping and MSG and a beautiful park on Madison Avenue. I wish we would have planned a longer stay but I'm happy to have a place to escape to this summer! Kudos to whoever is leading this team, well done!
Great location and comfortable rooms. Wheelchair accessible rooms should have handheld shower heads/hose.
Great location to where I was visiting and the rooms were clean and up to date. My wife and I enjoyed it. Restaurant was great too

This is a solid and recently remodeled hotel in Manhattan. Rooms are small, but not unusually so for NY and it is very clean and comfortable. Our only complaint is that (despite the management responses to other reviews) they clearly have an issue with the elevators. 1 (of 2) elevators worked with 17 floors of guest rooms, meaning a frequent long wait for the elevator.

review_body: Our stay at the Henri was great! The hotel is centrally located and close to transportation facilities! Our rooms were clean comfortable and generally inviting! The most impressive factor was the staff! Everyone was informative and helpful to us during our stay. Their courtesy and attention to details made our stay one we won’t soon forget! I would recommend the Henri to anyone who wants to be “in the middle of the action” without getting frazzled! Thanks to the Henri for a wonderful stay

I've stayed here several times since December for work. It is a really good location and close to subway which will take you anywhere. The lightning in the rooms is my main challenge. It is kind of dark and not great for working which is why I am in NYC. They lack a fitness room too and the breakfast is ok. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I like the upstairs lounge for a nightcap. If you don't plan to spend a ton of time in the hotel room than this would be a good place to stay. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean.

We were put on the 17th floor which right under the nightclub. Constant pounding music which we don't necessarily dislike but it goes on until 2:30AM. Then the staff drags the bar stools across the room during their cleanup which was noisier than the music. This goes on until 3:30AM. According to the person at the front desk that I complained to we should have been made aware of the night club above our floor.....WE WERE NOT NOTIFIED.....we would asked for a room change. As an accommodation, the resort fees were waived but being that we had 2 separate reservations only the 2nd reservation fees were waived. The one night reservation fee was not waived. On first day of service the room was barely cleaned.....sinks had coffee stains, floors not vacuumed, etc....on subsequent days the cleaning was satisfactory. I am the travel agent on record and at this point I am not comfortable booking this hotel for my clients, in spite of the excellent location.

The updates that have been made over the last few years are fantastic. I love the property, 17th floor lounge and the lower level bar area. I was however somewhat disappointed in the quality of the bed. No box spring, and a wooden bed frame makes for a loud night if you toss and turn while you sleep.

The hotel was underwhelming from the start, with rooms that were dark, small, and uninviting. The breakfast as well was underwhelming. Then one of the two elevators broke and it sometimes took 10 minutes to be able to get up or down from the 14th floor. We checked out after one night because the hotel was so bad.

Only one elevator Working, so the wait to use it was a little annoying, but we understood you were waiting for part to repair. Outside of that little glich, everything was fine, except did not have any decaf coffee for breakfast..

Rooms are cozy but very stylish and modern. Comfy bed and I like the bathroom. It is small but the shower is nice. Another great touch is the well stocked mini bar with nuts, chocolates, and liquor. HD TV is always nice too.What really separates this place though is the service. Chuck at the front desk is great and friendly and eager to provide good customer service which is great. I would recommend this place for it's stylish vibe and fantastic location.

This is a great place to stay if you want to be conveniently located BUT a little peace and quiet too. The Penthouse breakfast was very nice. Variety of cold cereal and gourmet type array of fresh baked goods. Delicious coffee and teas. Friendly and accomodating atmosphere -- great staff and at a moment's notice. I'd stay here again as it feels like you've arrived home after a busy day of sight seeing and shopping. Check out the evening happy hour as well and there is a great little greek place right next door.

Hotel Henri is on 24th street and has a great vibe. Comfortable bed, fun room, staff was great. We walked to the Hi Line and explored the neighborhood. Whitney museum, ample street parking if you are ok with walking a few blocks.

Small Hotel but great location. I used to stay in the Times Square area which gets flooded with tourists but this hotel helped me to discover the Chelsea and Flatiron Area. It is across the street from Eataly and next to several of the mean subway stations. The rooms are very clean and the front desk service is top notch. I was running late for check out due to a meeting and asked the front desk for a later check-out than normal. They were more than understanding and told me not to rush. I will be back and I will book through the website so I get the free breakfast.

I really enjoyed my 5 night stay at the Hotel Henri.Great Location: Just down the block from Eataly and Madison Park and many subway options.Great Staff: A shout out to Carlos the bellman who took extra good care of me as well as Chad at the font desk who easily righted a small problem I was having. It's a small hotel with a small staff, yet they always were attentive and helpful.Breakfast - a selection of pastries and cereals in their penthouse lounge each morning was a great way too get the day started and I appreciated the extended service until 11am as I had a few late nights in the city.My Room - While a bit small, It had a very comfy bed and still offered just the right amount of space and with a very comfortable size bathroom. Perhaps a bit more lighting would be nice, as I often kept my blinds closed since my view was of an office building across the alley....thus their view would be of me. Next time I may request a 24th street facing room - however, it was quiet on the back side of the hotel. I never had time to enjoy the Greek Restaurant in their lobby - but perhaps next time, as there will certainly be a next time.Thanks for a great stay.Erik - Seattle, WA

What a find! I am so glad I booked Hotel Henri. Location is fantastic....rooms were fabulous...the whole hotel was just terrific. I'd stay there again and recommend it in a heart beat. The value for money is without question. Breakfast is included in the rooftop penthouse so you get to enjoy a great view over a morning coffee. Its Boutique style and tucked away from the crowds.

I stayed here for the weekend with my girlfriend as a stay-cation and it was an overall great experience. We checked in early and had a cocktail/bar bites in the new restaurant. The food was great and the service was exceptional. The room was very nice...extremely comfortable and very unique...we had a great view of downtown Manhattan. At night we went upstairs to the penthouse lounge and had a few drinks in the new speakeasy space that was very nice! The next time we are going to have a stay-cation I would definitely come back and stay at Hotel Henri...it is the perfect place for a weekend stay!!!

Was in town for a few days and decided to book because of the location. The rooms were a good size and everyone there was friendly. Really liked the interior design and the mood setting in the room. The staff was helpful in recommending restaurants/bars to go to. Will definitely book again. P.S. the rooftop lounge is amazing, a must try.

I recently stayed 3 nights at hotel henri and it was amazing. The front desk were so kind and helpful. Anytime i needed directions or advice on what to do or eat, they had great recomendations. The rooms are very chic and am told recently renovated. Beds were super comfy and everything seemed to fit perfectly. The restaurant is new and called Mykonos Blue Grill. Great greek food and very elegant design. Nice that it connects to the lobby and feels so open. My recomendation is the greek salad. There is also a rooftop bar called Sir Henri which is gorgeous. Its one of these speakeasy cocktail bars with great tasting cocktails. My friends and i had fun trying the different cocktails each night. The music and DJ make the place fun. A very nice crowd comes in. Great date place i think. Overall great experience and i wish more hotels would go independant and have the flair that Henri has. And piece of advice, if you book direct they give you free breakfast. Which is a plus.

Hallway baseboards were being painted; room smelled like paint. I was trying to take a nap after horrid flight in storm, but workmen's radios going in the hallway! Sheet over comforter was stained; requested a new one that never came, so I tossed it in the corner. Comforter was upside down, so tag slapped me in the face during the night. Doors closed hard and loud when you let go, so doors everywhere were slamming all the time. Bathroom shelf was dusty. Heat settings were way off and difficult to adjust.

Clean, cool, lovely staff, great location. I enjoyed my stay at the Henri. It can get a bit loud if people are in the hallways waiting for the elevators, but other than that, I highly recommend this boutique hotel in Chelsea. I didn’t make it up to the Penthouse happy hour...next time!

review_body: Overall, we had a good stay here. It's a Wyndham masquerading as a boutique hotel, so the room has been redone to look like the Ace hotel (example: one wall looks like it's concrete that's been tagged with "always be a poet" but it's really wallpaper) and very dim Edison style bulbs in the room. There's LED rope lighting around the bed frame and headboard. Room is small (it's NYC, all hotel rooms are small) but since it's sparsely decorated there's enough room to move around. The shower is great. Mini bar features outrageously priced booze, snacks, and an intimacy kit with condom, lube, and vibrating ring in case you forgot stuff. But you can walk to the CVS around the corner for any of those items (okay, maybe not the ring) if you'd prefer to not pay for the convenience. All in all, they've turned a sleepy business hotel into Stuff Millenials Like, but even if you're not in the target audience you'll find the room to be comfortable.But since the Henri is trying to be Stuff Millenials Like, they have a rooftop bar with loud music at night. When I read about the bar when I booked it I thought it would be a nice quiet place to have a drink and look at the city. When we checked in on a Saturday, our room was two floors under the bar and all we could hear until the wee hours of the morning was the thumping bass of EDM. We had packed a white noise machine and had a bluetooth speaker in our suitcase, so between the machine at its loudest setting and the speaker cranked up playing a white noise app on my phone we were able to mask the thump enough to get some sleep. If you're here on a weekend, consider having something like that in your suitcase unless you're planning to be out all night. (We had a cruise to get up for in the morning, so partying like a rock star was not an option for us.)All in all, the Henri is well located and has a comfy bed. There's no breakfast offered, but there's plenty of food nearby. It's trying too hard to be hip, but if you can excuse that you can get a little sleep.

Overall everything about this hotel was perfect. I don't usually like the hustle and bustle of New York hotels and find everything about them rush rush.From the moment we checked in there was a line but immediately we were acknowledged and told we will be right with you. After a few minutes we were greeted by the front desk agent who was a lovely young woman. She told us where everything was and offered us some fruit flavored water. Nice touch because we were driving in traffic for two hours and were thirsty. After a brief explanation of where the elevators were and and how to get wifi access we went to our room. Everything about the room was perfect. It was clean and the room smelled like fresh flowers..... Not sure if they have a flower sent coming from somewhere but it was a nice touch. Overall when i want to be in midtown area again and not in the heart of the craziness I will definitely return. This place is for sure a gem and i didn't really want to review it because i don't want it getting sold out lol.

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Henri for a romantic weekend getaway. Location was ideal! We were very pleased with the whole experience! The people at the front desk greeted us with a warm welcome. The reception area had a cozy vibe. All the staff that we had encountered were polite and courteous. Our room was inviting, clean, and comfortable. My wife and I enjoyed drinks at the lovely rooftop bar. We also enjoyed food in the outdoor restaurant. The concierge was well informed of nearby restaurants and hotspots. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we will recommend the hotel to our friends.

Have stayed here a couple of times now and will return every time from now. As a frequent business traveler to NYC I have stayed in many hotels around the city. This one has the perfect balance... great location with good restaurants around for the evening, great service and friendly staff.... Mr. Aldoy the new GM there is great, and reasonable rates! Room was spacious and modern in feel and very comfortable. I would totally recommend to anyone traveling on business or leisure!

The property and room were very clean and the staff was friendly. Just 2 small issues. There was no way to turn a light on/off while laying in bed. After my first night, the following morning, I woke up and realized that the coffee pods for the in-room coffee maker had not been replenished the day before.

My wife and I enjoyed a week in Manhattan, basing our adventures out of Hotel Henri. Fabulous staff, excellent property. Super location - 10-15 minute walk to MSG, 15-20 to Times Square and Broadway theaters, 25-30 to Central Park or Chelsea Market. Away from the Times Square crush, but easy cab grab to anywhere (20 minutes to Battery Park!). Rooms are generous by NYC standards, and very comfortable. Best hotel staff experience we've had anywhere in the world! Eataly (Italian market and restaurant) - across the street - is an absolute MUST.

The Hotel Is fairly clean. Rooms are small but recently appointed. As many reciewers habe mentioned the Wi-Fi doesn't work. Went to the front desk foe help but there isn't any. I think the issue is that they have a small week system that can't support the traffic so it won't let new people on to the open router. So hotel is okay if you aren't trying to do any work that requires Wi-Fi. And be prepared to hear noise from the room above (ie toilet flushing).
